commit_message:
Enable CentOS 7 distro jobs

The necessary packages are now shipping for CentOS so we can deploy
and ship Cinder directly from packages and gate on that.

Change-Id: I16710c2b8e4ee2f11f85d6db1c5270481bd1fc70

subject: Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules
messages:
[{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-02 17:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-02 18:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-03 10:05:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Unfortunately [1] and [2] are using the openstack & cinder clients on the target node. So for now we'll need to implement the openstack_openrc role on the target (or on the service setup host) so that those tasks can complete. In parallel we should implement upstream modules in ansible to do the same. There is already the capability for [1] in the openstacksdk [3], but not for [2] so there is quite a bit of work to be done..

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder/blob/master/tasks/cinder_backends.yml
[2] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder/blob/master/tasks/cinder_qos.yml
[3] https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/a99d6f19123ea540891f4ef00bf2c6b39d9963f6/openstack/block_storage/v2/_proxy.py#L105-L130"}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-03 19:59:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-03 19:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-04 12:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-04 12:54:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-06 13:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-06 13:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-13 10:22:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-13 10:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-13 11:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-13 11:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 17:45:44.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The 'shade' client library is not required any more now that we're
installing it via openstack_hosts. As there are no required packages left, the
task to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Change-Id: Iaf3084f597be0585cbd712bbdb9aa826c1f0c1eb

We still need to implement the openrc file on the target host for the cinder
backends and qos tasks. Those use the cinder venv so we don't need packages
installed on the host for them - we do just need the openrc file. Once these
shell tasks can be replaced with os_* module tasks we can change the
implementation to use them and remove the openrc role execution.

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The 'shade' client library is not required any more now that we're
installing it via openstack_hosts. As there are no required packages left, the
task to install them is also removed.

We still need to implement the openrc file on the target host for the cinder
backends and qos tasks. Those use the cinder venv so we don't need packages
installed on the host for them - we do just need the openrc file. Once these
shell tasks can be replaced with os_* module tasks we can change the
implementation to use them and remove the openrc role execution.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580156
Change-Id: Iaf3084f597be0585cbd712bbdb9aa826c1f0c1eb

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters replace
the rabbitmq values and aure used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be transparent
to the ceilometer service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation in config template
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory
* Update tests
* Add release note

Change-Id: Ib14a7a5ec0348933eee4fb1a151010841b29ca1f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 15:30:02.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure __pycache__ folder is deleted

In some cases like [1] when running python3, the cleanup of
the virtualenv is incomplete: While the *.pyc files are removed,
the python3 __pycache__ folder is not removed.

That causes the sed instruction (applying to files) to fail,
as the __pycache__ folder is not a regular file, but a folder.

With the sed not successfully running, the shebang of the
virtualenv is pointing to an incorrect location, causing then
a failure in keystone-manage commands.

This should fix the problem.

[1]: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/BWB2q8Y4Gt/

Change-Id: Id28fd1c4989bfff1d0d736c037b8f0e77eb082c1
'}, {'created': '2018-07-11 06:37:32.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure __pycache__ folder is deleted

In some cases like [1] when running python3, the cleanup of
the virtualenv is incomplete: While the *.pyc files are removed,
the python3 __pycache__ folder is not removed.

That causes the sed instruction (applying to files) to fail,
as the __pycache__ folder is not a regular file, but a folder.

With the sed not successfully running, the shebang of the
virtualenv is pointing to an incorrect location, causing then
a failure in keystone-manage commands.

On top of it, a success would happen should the last command
return 0. We now make sure the whole script must return
success.

This should fix the problem.

[1]: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/BWB2q8Y4Gt/

Change-Id: Id28fd1c4989bfff1d0d736c037b8f0e77eb082c1

[1]: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/BWB2q8Y4Gt/

Change-Id: Id28fd1c4989bfff1d0d736c037b8f0e77eb082c1

commit_message:
Ensure __pycache__ folder is deleted

When running python3, the cleanup of
the virtualenv is incomplete: While the *.pyc files are removed,
the python3 __pycache__ folder is not removed.

That causes the sed instruction (applying to files) to fail,
as the __pycache__ folder is not a regular file, but a folder.

With the sed not successfully running, the shebang of the
virtualenv is pointing to an incorrect location, causing then
a failure in keystone-manage commands.

On top of it, a success would happen should the last command
return 0. We now make sure the whole script must return
success.

This should fix the problem.

Change-Id: Id28fd1c4989bfff1d0d736c037b8f0e77eb082c1

[{'created': '2018-06-30 04:44:55.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor - remove extra for loop

This change refactors the logic for obtaining methods from an
integer. Instead of creating a list of integers to later loop
through in order to create a list of methods, skip ahead to
creating a list of methods since we already have the int key and
can pull the method from the map.

Change-Id: I4fc5b23b8f82d0f475a0ca787f2df10af1ed7238
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor - remove extra for loop

This change refactors the logic for obtaining methods from an
integer. Instead of creating a list of integers to later loop
through in order to create a list of methods, skip ahead to
creating a list of methods since we already have the int key and
can pull the method from the map.

Change-Id: I4fc5b23b8f82d0f475a0ca787f2df10af1ed7238

commit_message:
Ensure __pycache__ folder is deleted

In some cases when running python3, the cleanup of
the virtualenv is incomplete: While the *.pyc files are removed,
the python3 __pycache__ folder is not removed.

That causes the sed instruction (applying to files) to fail,
as the __pycache__ folder is not a regular file, but a folder.

With the sed not successfully running, the shebang of the
virtualenv is pointing to an incorrect location, causing then
a failure in keystone-manage commands.

On top of it, a success would happen should the last command
return 0. We now make sure the whole script must return
success.

This should fix the problem.

Change-Id: I2999f9253e8bb70854e02768aef13f3b57839987

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 15:41:45.000000000', 'message': "Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: Iab894de117a3d84b78246d09d343dc0a85335f28

commit_message:
Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Also, a bunch of outdated tox configuration was updated
to match other repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: Iab894de117a3d84b78246d09d343dc0a85335f28

Fix usage of "|" for tests

With the more recent versions of ansible, we should now use
"is" instead of the "|" sign for the tests.

This should fix it.

commit_message:
Fix usage of "|" for tests

With the more recent versions of ansible, we should now use
"is" instead of the "|" sign for the tests.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: Idea3c1336b5dd10bd9dfc075587cc130a0a34449

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our

maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes

commit_message:
Make scheduler check online_extend_support capability

Since Pike release, Cinder supports volume online extending, and by
default it assumes that every backend supports this feature. This
assumption causes a bug on those backends that don't support it. On
such backends, an online extending attempt leaves the volume in
error_extending state.

This patch allows a backend to report to the scheduler if it does not
support online extending. This way, an online extending attempt will
fail, without leaving the volume in error_extending state.

Closes-bug: #1765182
Change-Id: I2c31b5c171574074a8fc7ba86f94f983fc9658f7
Co-Authored-By: Lucio Seki <luciomitsuru.seki@fit-tecnologia.org.br>

Remove testrepository

This commit is a follow-up of "switch to using stestr"

After switch to using stestr, testrepository is unnecessary
and should be removed.

commit_message:
Ensure python3 compatibility

Currently everything is wired in the venv to work on python2.
If the virtualenv was built during repo build with python3, the
linking of the library will fail, as the lib folder for python2
doesn't exist.

This should solve the issue by ensuring the existing lib folder
of the env is used.

A problem arises then: Different distros organise packages
differently, in different locations. This makes the approach
compatible with multi-distros and multiple python versions.

Change-Id: I02b296089d5351d68bb14e87e458a4f5d18a4776

Add OS_AUTH_TYPE env var in openrc file

Default value: password

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 20:55:37.000000000', 'message': 'Make space for Cinder/Swift nodes if using nspawn

Currently if CONTAINER_TECH=nspawn is uses, Cinder and Swift
are unable to create volumes as space is fully allocated for
machines volume.

This shrinks machine00 mount to 8192 to make space for Cinder
and Swift volumes when using nspawn for the container tech.

Change-Id: Ief0040f638f0d3570557ac76fd5e0a8aee80df8d
'}]
commit_message:
Make space for Cinder/Swift nodes if using nspawn

Currently if CONTAINER_TECH=nspawn is uses, Cinder and Swift
are unable to create volumes as space is fully allocated for
machines volume.

This shrinks machine00 mount to 8192 to make space for Cinder
and Swift volumes when using nspawn for the container tech.

Change-Id: Ief0040f638f0d3570557ac76fd5e0a8aee80df8d

commit_message:
Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: I7c164fed373e8211e05ff7708b4b3485a1341806

commit_message:
Use rsync instead of synchronize module for remote copy

The synchronize module with delegation introduces complexity
with permissions which we really, really do not need to have
to deal with for a remote sync. So instead, we just use rsync
because it's simpler to use and understand.

Change-Id: I6fae5af8d59ea9499cc90a35f1d2f5176fbf9d04
Related-Bug: #1718356

commit_message:
Notify not only aodh-api service but also apache

Not only the aodh-api service is notified but also the apache service if
the API is run using apache. This ensures apache is restarted on config
changes.

Change-Id: I3967584431c547c2431c9b614de9db6416169567

commit_message:
Notify not only heat-api service but also apache

Not only the heat-api and heat-api-cfn services are notified, but also
the apache service if the API is run using apache. This ensures apache
is restarted on config changes.

Change-Id: I68feb50a466b56b027573cda099191f6b26ddbfd

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I5b9303dd1fe63c58c6f4acd3bc0f391e12d99ad8

commit_message:
Deploy steps - versioned objects

Adds a 'deploy_step' field to the Node object.

Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <rloo@oath.com>

Change-Id: I3393cc0f6506fe0a8dd655b3e2b9c48fcc921808
Story: #1753128
Task: #22592

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 01:16:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add basic bash_completion to swiftclient

This patch basically follows the bash completion
model that other OpenStack clients use. It creates
a new command to swiftclient called `bash_completion`
that outputs all the commands and flags defined inside
the swiftclient shell.

This is used by the swift.bash_completion script to
allow swift commands to be bash completed.

To make it work, place the swift.bash_completion file
into /etc/bash_completion.d and source it:

  cp tools/swift.bash_completion /etc/bash_completion.d/swift
  source /etc/bash_completion.d/swift

I call this basic, as the tab complete will simply give you
all flags and commands. One day it would be better to improve
it to complete based on the subcommand already used.

But this basic version is on kin with what nova, cinder and heat
are doing.

Change-Id: I5609a19018269762b4640403daae5827bb9ad724
'}, {'created': '2018-06-29 02:57:11.000000000', 'message': "Add bash_completion to swiftclient

This patch basically follows the bash completion
model that other OpenStack clients use. It creates
a new command to swiftclient called `bash_completion`.

The `bash_completion` command by default will print
all base flags and exsiting commands. If you pass
it a command, it'll print out all base flags and
any flags that command accepts. So as you type, and
auto-complete you swift command only available flags
will be offered to you.

This is used by the swift.bash_completion script to
allow swift commands to be bash completed.

To make it work, place the swift.bash_completion file
into /etc/bash_completion.d and source it:

  cp tools/swift.bash_completion /etc/bash_completion.d/swift
  source /etc/bash_completion.d/swift

Because swiftclient itself is creating this flag/command output
it should automatically add anything we add to the swiftclient
CLI.

Change-Id: I5609a19018269762b4640403daae5827bb9ad724

commit_message:
Add bash_completion to swiftclient

This patch basically follows the bash completion
model that other OpenStack clients use. It creates
a new command to swiftclient called `bash_completion`.

The `bash_completion` command by default will print
all base flags and exsiting commands. If you pass
it a command, it'll print out all base flags and
any flags that command accepts. So as you type out
your swift command and auto-complete, only the current
available flags are offered to you.

This is used by the swift.bash_completion script to
allow swift commands to be bash completed.

To make it work, place the swift.bash_completion file
into /etc/bash_completion.d and source it:

  cp tools/swift.bash_completion /etc/bash_completion.d/swift
  source /etc/bash_completion.d/swift

Because swiftclient itself is creating this flag/command output
it should automatically add anything we add to the swiftclient
CLI.

Change-Id: I5609a19018269762b4640403daae5827bb9ad724

commit_message:
Iterate once in network-environment.yaml

This replaced multiple for loops with a single loop.
This changes the ordering in the rendered file to have
one section per network, instead of one section per
perameter such as VLAN, AllocationPools.

It also reduces the use of jinja conditionals. This
results in some duplicated comment strings in the
jinja template.

This is a micro optimization, but this makes sense
as a follow on will add the possibility to add
multiple subnets on each network in network_data.yaml.
I.e we avoid additional nested loops over the subnets.

Related: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I0f11acaf7c25ff5d240db1daae2dc2b051c0a3b2

commit_message:
Update output messaging for standalone/undercloud

With the exposing of the tripleo deploy command, the installation and
success messaging should be different in the containerized undercloud
case vs the standalone.  This change adds different messaging to be
added at the end of the undercloud installation and reduces what we
print when standalone is used.

Change-Id: I99ce8abde838f16cabefe641b107e55b508c2cf9
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

Mark tripleo deploy experimental

The tripleo deploy command is experimental when not being invoked via
the containerized undercloud installation.

Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

commit_message:
Fix doc format errors

This fixes all the documentation formatting errors detected by sphinx
when running the docs tox environment.

The change in conf.py is needed to suppress the unknown option warning
documented in [1] and [2]

[1] https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/sphinx-users/6F_EJUEA2f8
[2] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/2229

Change-Id: Ib209fa9db7d2d896a34c54919afa396044ad29b7

commit_message:
Adds check for virtualenv in quickstart.sh bootstrap function

In https://review.openstack.org/578081 a similar check is added
for the reproducer template in oooq-extras. After discussion it
was suggested we also guard in the same way here. If there is no
virtualenv then use the existing install_deps function.

Change-Id: Ie933582948f51b0474315ca7708efc8c25aa1f07

[{'created': '2018-07-12 19:49:12.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fix physical_host loading from group/host vars

Same problem we had with ansible_host in
I22c09c4de86233329f337b535b709cd5320c40d3, now physical_host must be
configured inside the ini inventory, and will not be loaded from
the vars.

Change-Id: I3798529cf2bf73afbff2d2ef0f3fe17d91123fbc
'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 19:58:26.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fix physical_host loading from group/host vars

Commit I76af71ffe19b2a8afb18ed731f1362a4e399c613 broke the ability
to define physical_host in host_vars and group_vars. The physical_host
is only loaded from the ini inventory.

(The fix is commented in strategy, leaving it commented/WIP to confirm
that the tests fail as expected.)

Change-Id: I3798529cf2bf73afbff2d2ef0f3fe17d91123fbc
'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 23:13:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix physical_host loading from group/host vars

Commit I76af71ffe19b2a8afb18ed731f1362a4e399c613 broke the ability
to define physical_host in host_vars and group_vars. The physical_host
is only loaded from the ini inventory.

Change-Id: I3798529cf2bf73afbff2d2ef0f3fe17d91123fbc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix physical_host loading from group/host vars

Commit I76af71ffe19b2a8afb18ed731f1362a4e399c613 broke the ability
to define physical_host in host_vars and group_vars. The physical_host
is only loaded from the ini inventory.

Change-Id: I3798529cf2bf73afbff2d2ef0f3fe17d91123fbc

so there should use 'tox -e py27integration' command.

subject: Re-calculate outputs at the end of a stack-update.
messages:
[{'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2018-06-20 18:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-21 23:48:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15435, 'date': '2018-06-27 14:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You can split the before_props translation change into its own commit, along with its own unit test update.  I had originally fixed these at the same time as part of a series of stack-update robustness fixes.'}, {'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2018-06-27 18:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2018-06-27 18:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-27 23:22:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

This seems fine, but it would be interesting to know what was calling get_output() prior to the update completing. I think the fact that we weren't invalidating was predicated on the assumption that nothing would call that until after the resource was COMPLETE."}, {'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2018-06-27 23:50:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15435, 'date': '2018-06-28 13:29:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

The original customer issue that this fixed only was able to be reproduced in a non-convergence setup.  When convergence was enabled, it was not reproducable.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-28 18:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

That makes sense, because in convergence we load a new copy of the resource from the DB just to update it, so nothing that happened prior would have any effect. (c.f. pre-convergence, where everything was sitting around in memory for the whole duration of the stack update.)

Possibly the culprit is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435177/30/heat/engine/stack.py@862

It would be great to have a test for this.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-04 12:39:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

agree with Zane on having a test for it
Also might also help if describe in the comment to notify this is for non-convergence mode'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-13 03:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2018-07-13 23:13:56.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I confirmed this with Al. He hasn't been able to reproduce this issue since pike after removing this change even in non-convergence, which makes him think it was indirectly fixed somewhere else. Hence, Abandoning."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-20 18:57:09.000000000', 'message': 'Re-calculate outputs at the end of a stack-update.

Currently,the code appears to allow a stack to be updated which alters its
outputs (adding or removing ports) however the other stacks access its old
(cached) outputs when attempting to use those as their inputs during update.
This change causes the cache to be invalidated and the proper outputs are
accessed.

This also fixes a scenario where translation validation of older properties
fails due to those properties being deleted during a stack update.

Change-Id: I1b6f64fe985e0b47115935025cae5bfcbe6a9966
Story: 2002625
Task: 22266
'}, {'created': '2018-06-27 18:23:24.000000000', 'message': 'Re-calculate outputs at the end of a stack-update.

Currently,the code appears to allow a stack to be updated which alters its
outputs (adding or removing ports) however the other stacks access its old
(cached) outputs when attempting to use those as their inputs during update.
This change causes the cache to be invalidated and the proper outputs are
accessed.

Change-Id: I1b6f64fe985e0b47115935025cae5bfcbe6a9966
Story: 2002625
Task: 22266
'}]
commit_message:
Re-calculate outputs at the end of a stack-update.

Currently,the code appears to allow a stack to be updated which alters its
outputs (adding or removing ports) however the other stacks access its old
(cached) outputs when attempting to use those as their inputs during update.
This change causes the cache to be invalidated and the proper outputs are
accessed.

Change-Id: I1b6f64fe985e0b47115935025cae5bfcbe6a9966
Story: 2002625
Task: 22266

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 07:53:26.000000000', 'message': '[Fullstack] Respawn dhclient process in case of error

When dhclient process is started as async process by fake machine resource,
it might happen that "None" will be returned as first line of output
from this process. This is treated as an error and dhclient is halted
immediately.
Because of that fake machine don't have configured IP address and
test fails.

This patch adds "respawn_timeout" value set to 5 seconds for dhclient
async process. When dhclient process is restarted it should works fine
and IP address should be then configured properly.

Change-Id: Ie056578abbe6e18c8415c6e61d755f2248a70541
Closes-Bug: #1728948
(cherry picked from commit 92959238a3e408e810ccd4f3d3d453a35afb5bba)
'}, {'created': '2018-06-21 07:40:54.000000000', 'message': '[Fullstack] Respawn dhclient process in case of error

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Respawn dhclient process in case of error

When dhclient process is started as async process by fake machine resource,
it might happen that "None" will be returned as first line of output
from this process. This is treated as an error and dhclient is halted
immediately.
Because of that fake machine don't have configured IP address and
test fails.

This patch adds "respawn_timeout" value set to 5 seconds for dhclient
async process. When dhclient process is restarted it should works fine
and IP address should be then configured properly.

Change-Id: Ie056578abbe6e18c8415c6e61d755f2248a70541
Closes-Bug: #1728948
(cherry picked from commit 92959238a3e408e810ccd4f3d3d453a35afb5bba)

commit_message:
Update specs template

Partially merge changes to the specs template from Rocky nova-specs.

Still leaving out stuff that shouldn't apply to nova-powervm, like
notifications and REST API changes.

Change-Id: If2df2b278ba555cf4d5d04cca19079c2749ca202

commit_message:
cleanup HACKING.rst

A previous commit [1] removed two custom rules that were no longer
necessary, but did not remove their notation in HACKING.rst. This
cleans that up.

It also removes wording that is duplicating nova's HACKING.rst,
since we already explicitly state "Follow the nova HACKING.rst".

[1] 9b3abb325b3b8a7a67981af9046f3b78e61bd2db

Change-Id: I83bd9b8dcb39dd23e41288df11f46b381a49a2c7

commit_message:
Add support for deploying Apache Storm

The motiviation behind this is to provide Apache Storm for
the Monasca Thresh component which is used for generating
alerts as part of the Monasca Framework.

SHA512 sum is from http://www.us.apache.org/dist/storm/
apache-storm-1.1.2/apache-storm-1.1.2.tar.gz.sha

Change-Id: I6eb6be91470385c824baaeb37f90b582fc88aed4
Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers

Much like with apt installs, sometimes trying to install remote packages
will fail due to transient errors. We should also do retries with yum and
zypper to improve the success rate.

Change-Id: I94c28814ca0157cc1e592148ccd814f5b5d50814

commit_message:
Retry yum/zypper package installs

Much like with apt installs, sometimes trying to install remote packages
will fail due to transient errors. We should also do retries with yum and
zypper to improve the success rate.

Change-Id: I94c28814ca0157cc1e592148ccd814f5b5d50814
(cherry picked from commit 2d4d05b2cbb96dba959e6fcebcdca9a820b3ae7d)

[{'created': '2018-06-11 23:48:38.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Heal allocations with missing/incomplete consumer information

Allocations created before microversion 1.8 didn't have project_id
/ user_id consumer information. In Rocky those will be migrated
to have consumer records, but using configurable sentinel values.

As part of heal_allocations, we can detect this and heal the
allocations using the instance.project_id/user_id information.

This is something we'd need if we ever use Placement allocation
information counting quotas.

Related to blueprint add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: Idba40838b7b1d5389ab308f2ea40e28911aecffa

commit_message:
Heal allocations with incomplete consumer information

Allocations created before microversion 1.8 didn't have project_id
/ user_id consumer information. In Rocky those will be migrated
to have consumer records, but using configurable sentinel values.

As part of heal_allocations, we can detect this and heal the
allocations using the instance.project_id/user_id information.

This is something we'd need if we ever use Placement allocation
information counting quotas.

Note that we should be using Placement API version 1.28 with
consumer_generation when updating the allocations, but since
people might backport this change the usage of consumer
generations is left for a follow up patch.

Related to blueprint add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: Idba40838b7b1d5389ab308f2ea40e28911aecffa

commit_message:
Fix usage of "|" for tests

With the more recent versions of ansible, we should now use
"is" instead of the "|" sign for the tests.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I09b6bf32330a69b815544d7ff7e4c6e459617b54

- adds a blank default recipe to satisfy verification tests

commit_message:
Sync up Flask version with global-requirements

As Flask version was updated we need to update our own requirements.txt
to avoid reqirements-check job to fail on every patch that changes
anything related to requirements.

Change-Id: I22f471534eded46a8deecccdb07db71d0705226b
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add database clients to Monasca persister container

The Monasca persister supports persisting to InfluxDB,
Elasticsearch and Cassandra. We need python clients
for these repositores to support this.

Change-Id: I563913d5cd4fb779d2a475f39e0f34d0a92edee7
Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers

commit_message:
Adding VLAN support and other configs for sriov_vf

Allow additional settings for configuring sriov_vf types
such as vlan, qos, spoofcheck, trust mode, state control,
mac address, promisc.

Implements: blueprint sriov-vfs-as-network-interface
Change-Id: I078a202b1f5769d8b18db2618914edb5ad836919
Signed-off-by: Karthik S <ksundara@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 10:28:50.000000000', 'message': 'Increase the step for gnocchi_db_sync

swift-proxy and gnocchi both run on step_4. However, swift_proxy should
be ready before gnocchi. This patch moves gnocchi_db_sync to step_5 to
be sure that swift-proxy is started before gnocchi. gnocchi_db_sync has
higher start_order to start before other gnocchi services.
(cherry picked from commit 67489e63f07ea73d934e51666f19229a629a6c77)
Change-Id: I0044c78c4a6d751fc9d0cf6b54ed634032933934
Closes-Bug: 1781162
'}]
commit_message:
Increase the step for gnocchi_db_sync

swift-proxy and gnocchi both run on step_4. However, swift_proxy should
be ready before gnocchi. This patch moves gnocchi_db_sync to step_5 to
be sure that swift-proxy is started before gnocchi. gnocchi_db_sync has
higher start_order to start before other gnocchi services.
(cherry picked from commit 67489e63f07ea73d934e51666f19229a629a6c77)
Change-Id: I0044c78c4a6d751fc9d0cf6b54ed634032933934
Closes-Bug: 1781162

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ifd51e726de277d33ff61db47110bf8b5563fcda7

[{'created': '2018-07-05 18:29:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect Redis VIP declaration in fixed-ip-vips-v6.yaml

This patch fixes the incorrect Redis VIP declaration in
fixed-ip-vips-v6.yaml. The file incorrectly has vip.yaml
for the RedisVipPort instead of vip_v6.yaml, although the
fixed IP is an IPv6 address. This causes an error, and
conflicts with network-isolation-v6.yaml, so the deployment
works if network-isolation-v6.yaml is included after the
fixed-ip-vips-v6.yaml, but fails if it is included before.

Change-Id: Iffabbedfda77bc5cc4793700c459fb51b14f62d9
Closes-bug: 1778120
(cherry picked from commit 1ebf31414ebce3e88c028a34f0d9b4c8a5d5edab)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect Redis VIP declaration in fixed-ip-vips-v6.yaml

This patch fixes the incorrect Redis VIP declaration in
fixed-ip-vips-v6.yaml. The file incorrectly has vip.yaml
for the RedisVipPort instead of vip_v6.yaml, although the
fixed IP is an IPv6 address. This causes an error, and
conflicts with network-isolation-v6.yaml, so the deployment
works if network-isolation-v6.yaml is included after the
fixed-ip-vips-v6.yaml, but fails if it is included before.

Change-Id: Iffabbedfda77bc5cc4793700c459fb51b14f62d9
Closes-bug: 1778120
(cherry picked from commit 1ebf31414ebce3e88c028a34f0d9b4c8a5d5edab)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-30 18:57:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add default value for name_lower in network_data.yaml to update ServiceNetMap

In Pike and later, the name_lower field in network_data.yaml can be
re-defined to contain a custom network name.  When this is done the
ServiceNetMap field must be overridden to reflect the new name in all
places.  This changes adds a new optional field to network_data.yaml
that should be set to the original default name_lower value.
ServiceNetMap will then be automatically updated and will not need
to be overridden.

This also fixes the VipPort naming for the StorageManagement network
to not use a static value.

Change-Id: I8a238038122288899cef49faf38ea2c2ffc2176b
(cherry picked from commit d3eb296e19e5ec6d5e26ec8b261e119fed767494)
'}]
commit_message:
Add default value for name_lower in network_data.yaml to update ServiceNetMap

In Pike and later, the name_lower field in network_data.yaml can be
re-defined to contain a custom network name.  When this is done the
ServiceNetMap field must be overridden to reflect the new name in all
places.  This changes adds a new optional field to network_data.yaml
that should be set to the original default name_lower value.
ServiceNetMap will then be automatically updated and will not need
to be overridden.

This also fixes the VipPort naming for the StorageManagement network
to not use a static value.

Change-Id: I8a238038122288899cef49faf38ea2c2ffc2176b
(cherry picked from commit d3eb296e19e5ec6d5e26ec8b261e119fed767494)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 12:57:59.000000000', 'message': "Handle blank lines followed by comment in nic conversion script

Currently if a blank line is followed by a comment the 'last_non_comment_spaces'
variable gets reset, which results in the comment line not being indented.
This just ignores blank lines so that 'last_non_comment_spaces' isn't reset
and the comment line is properly indented.

Closes-Bug: 1779191
Change-Id: I286da578c42df24242ba38df12d42c8a8fdd4a4f
(cherry picked from commit f997e3da60fe21e545736f78f3045167e06f0d1b)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle blank lines followed by comment in nic conversion script

Currently if a blank line is followed by a comment the 'last_non_comment_spaces'
variable gets reset, which results in the comment line not being indented.
This just ignores blank lines so that 'last_non_comment_spaces' isn't reset
and the comment line is properly indented.

Closes-Bug: 1779191
Change-Id: I286da578c42df24242ba38df12d42c8a8fdd4a4f
(cherry picked from commit f997e3da60fe21e545736f78f3045167e06f0d1b)

[{'created': '2018-07-13 13:09:48.000000000', 'message': 'Assert a build timeout for zuul templated CI jobs

The new CI DSVM wrappers with zuul lack passing
a BUILD_TIMEOUT, thus the default value of 196
seconds is taking effect in devstack.

Explicitly setting to 600 should improve CI reliability.

Change-Id: If39f33d4f5e8e649729ecc9e5be33f9529d7b488
'}]
commit_message:
Assert a build timeout for zuul templated CI jobs

The new CI DSVM wrappers with zuul lack passing
a BUILD_TIMEOUT, thus the default value of 196
seconds is taking effect in devstack.

Explicitly setting to 600 should improve CI reliability.

Change-Id: If39f33d4f5e8e649729ecc9e5be33f9529d7b488

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary pyNN testenv

The pyNN factors automatically set basepython
unless explicitly requested otherwise.
Therefore, "testenv:py35" and "testenv:py27" sections
are unnecessary and should be removed.

Change-Id: I8ffed1b55324ebcec12a3f612a85de76ef362d1d

[{'created': '2018-07-13 17:13:55.000000000', 'message': "Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Also, a bunch of outdated tox configuration was updated
to match other repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: Iab59c893812db1d0da9a9b037e25a20d5a932408
"}]
commit_message:
Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Also, a bunch of outdated tox configuration was updated
to match other repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: Iab59c893812db1d0da9a9b037e25a20d5a932408

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 17:22:46.000000000', 'message': 'Increase default connection count to 4096

The current default is 1024 however this is not sufficent for most
deployments and it will cause a lot of issues if it does hit the
limit as the server will stop responding.

The overhead for this is very low and other deployment tooling
usually sets this to 8192[1], so 4096 is even very conservative.

[1]: https://github.com/saz/puppet-memcached/blob/bb9d55a2/manifests/init.pp#L26

Change-Id: I604f96a9431076e1f630d2045eac4c88a92935c1
(cherry picked from commit d784ea184605765e3f52d6456ba9b728212ff778)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase default connection count to 4096

The current default is 1024 however this is not sufficent for most
deployments and it will cause a lot of issues if it does hit the
limit as the server will stop responding.

The overhead for this is very low and other deployment tooling
usually sets this to 8192[1], so 4096 is even very conservative.

[1]: https://github.com/saz/puppet-memcached/blob/bb9d55a2/manifests/init.pp#L26

Change-Id: I604f96a9431076e1f630d2045eac4c88a92935c1
(cherry picked from commit d784ea184605765e3f52d6456ba9b728212ff778)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 04:26:47.000000000', 'message': "Updating required neutron version

build-openstack-sphinx-docs gate was raising an error and -1 on the
gate, due to neutron out of date version (12.0.0). This patch will bring
neutron from 13.0.0.0b1 to the newest version.

Error logs:
   ubuntu-xenial |     'router': constants.L3,
   ubuntu-xenial | AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'L3'

Please see more error logs in the following link
http://logs.openstack.org/04/557904/8/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/7a6b1da/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-03_04_00_47_083795

Change-Id: Ia4268421e5e8b1accf500b3a385ac15b23e0cd6f
"}]
commit_message:
Updating required neutron version

build-openstack-sphinx-docs gate was raising an error and -1 on the
gate, due to neutron out of date version (12.0.0). This patch will bring
neutron from 13.0.0.0b1 to the newest version.

Error logs:
   ubuntu-xenial |     'router': constants.L3,
   ubuntu-xenial | AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'L3'

Please see more error logs in the following link
http://logs.openstack.org/04/557904/8/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/7a6b1da/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-03_04_00_47_083795

Change-Id: Ia4268421e5e8b1accf500b3a385ac15b23e0cd6f

commit_message:
Remove ResourceManager aliases

These were kept around for backwards-compatibility reasons as part of
APIv2 development. Now that we are releasing a new major version of
python-saharaclient, we can remove them.

Change-Id: I2e57933472e23ad79645734de34a121e76f5e372

subject: Fix iptables insert command from -A to -I
messages:
[{'account_id': 28584, 'date': '2018-06-29 08:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-29 08:08:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28584, 'date': '2018-06-29 14:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

-A will make the 3121 port rule become the last one, which will be ignored because before that there is a DROP ALL rule.'}, {'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-07-13 16:29:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This was absolutely needed. Thanks for the contribution!'}]

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I5f07c8b8fb998a7c333e076a3f7c0de65568068c

'}, {'created': '2017-09-21 09:43:01.000000000', 'message': 'Support networkx 2.0

commit_message:
Support networkx 2.0

Networkx 2.0 released recently.  The main difference for us is that
"node" is no longer a dictionary and should be accessed via "nodes",
and the topological_sort returns an interator

Closes-Bug: 1712693
Change-Id: I78e89f2261b8b8d28c68b517c1e61691ab40016c

commit_message:
Add example group for the URI driver

Ensure the sample generator emits an example group with
instructions on how to define extra URI sources.

Change-Id: Ica556771d8dd37cb02d9ca69c04e888d187041ee
Blueprint: oslo-config-drivers
Signed-off-by: Moises Guimaraes de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 18:33:38.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: add config_source option

Define a config_source option that can be used to specify the
alternative sources that require drivers to load configuration
settings.

This patch does not currently load those settings, but the function to
do the loading is invoked at the right time and the tests are updated
to handle the new option that is being added.

Change-Id: Ibd5a6d306bb98d30d973dfe3604dcc0691d2e369
Blueprint: oslo-config-drivers
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add config_source option

Define a config_source option that can be used to specify the
alternative sources that require drivers to load configuration
settings.

Co-Authored-By: Moises Guimaraes de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ibd5a6d306bb98d30d973dfe3604dcc0691d2e369
Blueprint: oslo-config-drivers
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Create INI file ConfigurationSourceDriver.

The configuration source driver looks for an URI to setup the INIConfigurationSource.
The INIConfigurationSource class was created as a placeholder for now.
The allowed shemes so far are 'http' and 'https', we can add 'file' to also support
opening files from a path like: "file:///etc/foo/bar.conf"

Change-Id: I2e220346b2e3a0ea2171e28d785bf06f0abeb12b
Signed-off-by: Moises Guimaraes de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

subject: ConfigurationSource base class

commit_message:
ConfigurationSource base class

Creates and abstract base class for configuration sources
to be implemented off of.

Change-Id: I238930df61749a77b0a0aa4f033375972a159931
Blueprint: oslo-config-drivers

Base class for a configuration driver

Create a base class to support a configuration driver for Oslo.config

Change-Id: Idec1456c00dedb8c3628cbc4a934b870cd8dc7fc
Patially-Implements: blueprint oslo-config-db

The logic has changed since this patch was merged https://review.openstack.org/#/c/431619/ and seems that ipv6 is no longer disabled, shouldn't the test reflect this? I mean, I guess that we should remove the function instead of patching it"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-05-30 15:44:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> The logic has changed since this patch was merged https://review.openstack.org/#/c/431619/
 > and seems that ipv6 is no longer disabled, shouldn't the test
 > reflect this? I mean, I guess that we should remove the function
 > instead of patching it

But test which is modified here is testing neutron.agent.linux.bridge_lib.BridgeDevice class which still has disable_ipv6 method so IMO there is no point to remove coverage of this method in test"}, {'account_id': 19307, 'date': '2018-05-30 16:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Then more reason to remove it because this patch [1] moved disable_ipv6() from BridgeDevice to base IPDevice class

Even if it's inherited from different class, I don't see a reason why we should remove it? It might help e.g. if someone will overload this method in Bridge class :)"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-01 14:08:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 19307, 'date': '2018-06-01 14:09:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

well, I guess that's a matter of perspective, I think that it gives a better readability and coverage of the code if you have the unit tests testing the logic and the classes, however, the disable_ipv6() test is not doing anything of the above as I explained in the previous comments, the logic has changed and the function is not longer under that class. commit_message:
Fix UT BridgeLibTest when IPv6 is disabled

There was missing mock of
ipv6_utils.is_enabled_and_bind_by_default() in BridgeLibTest
unit tests and that cause failing some of tests from this module
when tests are running on host with disabled IPv6.
Now it's mocked and tests are running properly and are
testing what they should test.

Closes-Bug: #1773818
Change-Id: I9144450ce85e020c0e33c5214a2178acbbbf5f54

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Fix docs from I0dc80bee3ba6ff4ec8cc3fc113b6de7807e0bf2a

The CLI usage docs should mention the microversion
restriction for creating a flavor with a description
and setting a description on a flavor. Also, the release
note talks about setting the server description on the
flavor commands (wrong resource).

Change-Id: I93af3da9a0be62395a1c719fd1dcbfd2b669580d
Story: 2002196
Task:  22607

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 06:45:41.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I483632acf5a68075bbf200ffb172f945e5294cf8
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I483632acf5a68075bbf200ffb172f945e5294cf8

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I73e9613bf96da80d4dfd53246a568d0de691ae01

commit_message:
ceilometer: deprecation cleanup

Gnocchi dispatcher options will be removed upstream very soon [1].

But the deprecated options are still used in puppet-ceilometer and tht.

I proposed the puppet-gnocchi deprecation here [2]

ceilometer::dispatcher::gnocchi::url have been removed two cycles ago in
Ceilometer and is already ignored
.
ceilometer::dispatcher::gnocchi::archive_policy/filter_project are
passed to the url directly now.

ceilometer::dispatcher::gnocchi::resources_definition_file was set to
the default. So remove it does not change anything.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575368/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577794/

Change-Id: Ie0ff6f40d81b2e748347bd4c0e532531960bdefb

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-31 18:22:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-07 23:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-07 23:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-07 23:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-07 23:28:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I'm in a chicken-and-egg situation here (*)
- if the publish job can be defined here for the post-queue, then it can't be properly tested in production and it needs extra check, and its legacy version should be removed from project-config before merging this. At least for the periodic queue it seems possible to define in-tree a job which derives from publish-openstack-artifacts (seen on octavia).
- maybe the publish job can't be defined here, or can be defined here but it would be better to define it in project-config; then this review should be changed (this is the case for openstack-manuals and its publish-openstack-manuals). 
This change requires a bit of guidance from Zuul and Zuul-for-OpenStack experts.



(*) even if eggs existed before chickens"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-07 23:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-07-09 16:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-09 16:45:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-09 16:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Add native Zuul v3 build and publishing jobs

The new jobs replace (and move in-tree):
- legacy-sahara-extra-artifacts
- legacy-post-sahara-extra-artifacts

Unfortunately the new publish job can't be tested
beforehand, but we can fix it later.

Story: 2001686
Task: 8660

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/581087
Change-Id: I5b1ad485dfb23ce164473569b6bbc77fb37871ac

commit_message:
Remove sahara-extra legacy jobs, moving in-tree

The legacy jobs for sahara-extra which builds the artifacts and
publishes them are going to be moved downstream, but better remove
them first from here so that the post jobs (legacy and new)
do not conflict with each other.
This means a short interval where sahara-extra will not have a build
job, but the amount of patches for sahara-extra is really small.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/532691
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/581096
Change-Id: If924a8d2ee1de913452d81165993f94c31a42f6f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 13:16:52.000000000', 'message': "Run legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full in check queue in pike

legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full is in the integrated-gate
template but wasn't being run in the check queue in pike
even though it's run in the gate queue in pike. This fixes
the branches regex to run the job in the check queue in pike
to match the gate queue.

Change-Id: I9e92687f9cf16d5febcdf499ebb87f31f4447ef5
"}]
commit_message:
Run legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full in check queue in pike

legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full is in the integrated-gate
template but wasn't being run in the check queue in pike
even though it's run in the gate queue in pike. This fixes
the branches regex to run the job in the check queue in pike
to match the gate queue.

Change-Id: I9e92687f9cf16d5febcdf499ebb87f31f4447ef5

commit_message:
Use the openstacksdk task_manager constructor argument

We added an argument for setting the task_manager at construction time.
Use it.

Change-Id: I1366d80c2d1c695f663b864e475d258de59f7240
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/577616

commit_message:
Remove testrepository and .testr.conf

This commit is a follow-up of "switch to using stestr"
which was merged already [1].
After switch to using stestr, testrepository and .testr.conf
are unnecessary and should be removed.

This patch also switch from "testr" to "stestr" for coverage jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/575430

Change-Id: Ide998f902197ff24e28e998daa8defda090fab3f

'}, {'created': '2018-06-01 07:34:16.000000000', 'message': 'Adapt _validate_instance_group_policy to new policy model

To solve the race condition problem, we do anti-affinity policy
sanity check in the instance build code of compute manager, but
this check is only valid in original policy.

This patch updates the sanity check code to adapt
_validate_instance_group_policy to new policy model.

blueprint: complex-anti-affinity-policies

'}, {'created': '2018-07-09 13:58:36.000000000', 'message': 'Adapt _validate_instance_group_policy to new policy model

To solve the race condition problem, we do anti-affinity policy
sanity check in the instance build code of compute manager, but
this check is only valid in original policy.

Specifically, this change adds validation of the new
max_server_per_host policy rule which can be used to allow >1
anti-affinity group member on the same host.

blueprint: complex-anti-affinity-policies

commit_message:
Adapt _validate_instance_group_policy to new policy model

To solve the race condition problem, we do anti-affinity policy
sanity check in the instance build code of compute manager, but
this check is only valid in original policy.

Specifically, this change adds validation of the new
max_server_per_host policy rule which can be used to allow >1
anti-affinity group member on the same host.

blueprint: complex-anti-affinity-policies

Change-Id: I755b6fdddc9d754326cd9c81b6880581641f73e8

commit_message:
Add support for building Logstash

Add support for building Logstash 5.x for both Centos
and Debian based x86 distros.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers

commit_message:
healthcheck/memcached: add brackets if ipv6

If memcached is deployed to listen on a IPv6 address, the healthcheck
command needs to be run with the right argument and the host needs
brackets.

Change-Id: I9244514d8686f72b0c47aef333a005ff61ddfdf6

commit_message:
Avoid hard-coded settings in Manila HA containers

Add parameters for controlling the docker container settings used to
create the manila-share pacemaker bundle. The parameters eliminate the
need to hard-code the list of docker volumes and environment variables,
making it possible to control the values using hiera data.

For backward compatibility, the previous hard-coded values are used
when no parameter inputs are supplied.

Partial-Bug: #1749752
Change-Id: Ia81602f8a3454fcb0be2eaa9126021331d37b147

commit_message:
Add support for configuring additional architectures for heat-based installs

In this case an additional architecture is any architecture that is NOT
the same as the one running the install.

Blueprint: multiarch-support

Change-Id: Idbf9d52515bddf598792bf4db71c56084c36075c

commit_message:
Switch to using assert_has_calls() instead of assertEqual()

While adding multiarch support I noticed that some tests I was copying
had switched the values of actual and reference.  While this doesn't
alter the correctness of the tests it is somewhat strange when the tests
fail and a human is looking at the output.

Also during review Steve Baker noted we could use assert_has_calls() so
avoid confusing humans by switching :)

Change-Id: I996248f06ff47a7e20398848ae047eb4c2227dec

commit_message:
Add compute node L3 agent container for DVR

Neutron OVS DVR requires a L3 agent container with a special
configuration on the compute node.

Change-Id: Iab06c11de90b8ebc7dc6bd946367e5693a4a0f71
Closes-Bug: #1717316
(cherry picked from commit bb1100dd3dbe73ffe75f72e2ea56496620acc157)

commit_message:
Add environment/services-baremetal/*.

This works alongside of the new environments/baremetal-services.yaml
file in I373fef6581dfbfa365479f88d7b967cfbed446e4 to
enable baremetal services.

Change-Id: Ia61631e11dbbdbe39199db0afee2006b7e58cda2
(cherry picked from commit 882fb2a89697b175d9e6043f1da37ecc3efd92c9)

Before, all the tests were in tempest, and so the patch were always

commit_message:
Fix tempestmail regex

Before, all the tests were in tempest, and so the patch were always
tempest.x.y.tests, now that each project has their own tempest tests,
the regex needs to be updated, since we can have now
project_tempest_tests.x.y.tests.

Change-Id: If1df89e577b93267905f6ca9ca9bd4aab647c8a1
Closes-Bug: 1772522

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 14:46:43.000000000', 'message': 'Select default "openstack" plan when no plan-environment.yaml found

To avoid having a duplicate plan-environment and capabilities-map in
the root of the container as initially proposed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574753/, we check for a user provided
plan-environment.yaml and when none is found we select the default
"openstack" plan.

Change-Id: Ie26c2df437759a1b99c2498c9ba3039e2ac1c4ae
'}, {'created': '2018-07-04 13:44:48.000000000', 'message': 'Select default "openstack" plan when no plan-environment.yaml found

To avoid having a duplicate plan-environment and capabilities-map in
the root of the container as initially proposed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574753/, we check for a user provided
plan-environment.yaml and when none is found we select the default
"openstack" plan.

commit_message:
Select default "openstack" plan when no plan-environment.yaml found

To avoid having a duplicate plan-environment and capabilities-map in
the root of the container as initially proposed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574753/, we check for a user provided
plan-environment.yaml and when none is found we select the default
"openstack" plan.

Change-Id: Ie26c2df437759a1b99c2498c9ba3039e2ac1c4ae

commit_message:
Add workflow to select sample plan

This copies files from the plan-samples directory
based on the name of the sample plan (by directory)
so that we can easily select one of the plans on
plan creation.

Change-Id: I6fe2c38e31eb3537361be8f127f90ba21cc0c68d

longer published in these locations.

commit_message:
periodics: fix service of function version 0 not expiring issue

If a function version is created and then we create an execution using
version 0 of that function, then the service of version 0 of that
function will never expire. This commit fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I67ad2611b121b36368c15f9bf5d2268d430df3a6
Story: 2002956
Task: 22958

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated rpm package names

These packages produce a warning during the installation, we should
switch to their new names, usually to be specific about their use of
python2.

Change-Id: I0a80e822f64222d9a32aabd1fd834bcf794d6320

commit_message:
Switch to headless jre

Prefer the headless JRE wherever possible. This may be becessary to
adjust the override files for the customization of the containers where
java is installed.

Change-Id: I3479ac9e74aa9e860cf01db20bd7ab5f5cfc9c1a

during push into gerrit.

commit_message:
Add CI script to retrieve info from build logs

This should serve as a base for retrieving useful information from the
kolla build logs.

For now, the script warns about obsolete package names and helps track
packages that are installed too many times in different images.

It only supports rpm-based distros for now.

Change-Id: I160b6ede1336bd0c202621a48ca0218f72fc1270

commit_message:
Fix the cover tox target (switch to stestr)

The cover tox target was broken for a while.
Switch it to use coverage+stestr.

Change-Id: I015c0f3cb53d048587b3f57c76be8e7f4af37517

[{'created': '2018-06-07 16:44:59.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I766b8f8d86735669e0f5a1aa1545fda72e5712ca
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 02:20:04.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like

Change-Id: I766b8f8d86735669e0f5a1aa1545fda72e5712ca
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I766b8f8d86735669e0f5a1aa1545fda72e5712ca
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: update doc and conf template

Backport to stable/queens is useful, in particular because
the bgp.conf template contains a bogus configuration suggestion
(gre_tunnel_options="options:layer3=true" instead of  gre_tunnel_options="packet_type=legacy_l3"). Harmless because
commented out, but misleading.

commit_message:
Fix usage of "|" for tests

With the more recent versions of ansible, we should now use
"is" instead of the "|" sign for the tests.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I13391c1169475131547ef1fe8b6ee532b4362898

commit_message:
Reconfigure undercloud args for scenarios

scenario003,004,007: enable the containerized undercloud.
This partially reverts commit 184558bc3b71428c4c651f54c9e95a3c7fa9df6b.

Change-Id: Iae4c6e23477661ea32847885ab2135bb1646350d

commit_message:
Enforce use-heat=False on 3 jobs

* fs003: This job aims to test a non-containerized undercloud so let's make sure
  heat isn't enabled.

* fs016/017: scenario 001 and 002 are timeouting. Until we figure this
  out, let's make them deploying a non containerized undercloud.

Depends-On: Ibc6fb33d752346d6f8b3a61d74e0bc73c1ac20e3
Depends-On: I9ca5264b77660c34a91b051916cf17fcadf49b37
Change-Id: I7c9c016295fa28078706595dcf7c307e79b2a122

[{'created': '2018-01-19 06:09:23.000000000', 'message': "Actually use the arch and platform to select appropriate images

The prior changes in this series enabled uploading of images tagged in
such a way that they could be used with multiple architectures, this
change uses the data from instckenv.json to select appropriate deploy
images for each node as it's registered to ironic.

Blueprint: multiarch-support

commit_message:
Actually use the arch and platform to select appropriate images

The prior changes in this series enabled uploading of images tagged in
such a way that they could be used with multiple architectures, this
change uses the data from instckenv.json to select appropriate deploy
images for each node as it's registered to ironic.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Depends-On: Id82de41e7a49c2d8124fc74125ed51031579aa80
Depends-On: Idaf05b8efce28cd0cbf339cf693db4f55a693d9b
Depends-On: I41dce6e25766562db4366021309b8c2b74a8ab80
Change-Id: I7c84f3035853d8ee7b8d45895e7acce8e9dd3d13

commit_message:
Create classic undercloud hieradata overrides with any cli arg

There are other options but use-heat where we want a classic hieradata
file. For example --use-instack which is being developped. Let's fix the
logic so we can use undercloud_install_cli_options for anything except
--use-heat.

Change-Id: I9ca5264b77660c34a91b051916cf17fcadf49b37

[{'created': '2018-07-06 04:38:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix cookie session persistence in namespace driver

The old namespace driver was using, the long deprecated, appsession
option for APP_COOKIE session persistence. This fails on HAProxy 1.6
and later.
This patch moves that over to the modern stick table method.

Change-Id: I834958f711525c08fad12e280abc308820b20521
Story: 1640882
Task: 5321
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cookie session persistence in namespace driver

The old namespace driver was using, the long deprecated, appsession
option for APP_COOKIE session persistence. This fails on HAProxy 1.6
and later.
This patch moves that over to the modern stick table method.

Change-Id: I834958f711525c08fad12e280abc308820b20521
Story: 1640882
Task: 5321

[{'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-01-17 22:12:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-01-18 01:04:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Working on the requirements-check issue as introducing a new library to openstack.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-01-20 00:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-01-25 00:19:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I would like to check for how we can move forward with this review. Who else should be or could be on the review list?'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-02-22 19:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-03-02 18:53:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-03-08 00:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(16 comments)

In general this looks like fantastic work, and it's pretty exciting to think about this new feature landing in the nearish future :-)  I don't currently have time to read the code in great detail, but the main things from my side are avoiding major DRY violations (I think this is essential unless there is a really good excuse not to) and reconsidering the actual name of the feature, because of the negative connotations conveyed by the word "intrusive".'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-03-08 17:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

One of the key questions is how to integrate with the counterpart in instancemonitor. Several options: 1) refactor all shared code into a base class and use systemctl to control two separate services or 2)  migrate into the same service and use an configuration flag to turn on or off our new qemu-guest-agent based monitoring, 3) etc. will wait a bit to seek the consensus among us.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-03-08 17:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-03-22 14:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(11 comments)

Adam, thanks for your comments. Will have the next patch very soon.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-03-22 15:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 20191, 'date': '2018-04-24 01:26:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi Louie Kwan,

Need some more time to test this feature.
Till then is it possible for you address the review comments given on the spec:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/469070/'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-05-08 13:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

As discussed yesterday, I will be in IRC to answer questions and review comments given on the spec as well. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-05-08 14:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

The spec is reviewed. 

The enabling and disabling of the functionality is following the same path as instancemonitor for the moment.

Also here is a high level view of the main logic for the implementation:

1) filter is done by the following
- image property: hw_qemu_guest_agent=yes.
- _hasQemuGuestAgent() checks the virtio-serial interface/sock


2) _qemuAgentGuestPing () use virDomainQemuAgentCommand provided by libvirt-qemu

3) notification is done by _masakari_notifier() through masakari.SendNotification()'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-05-10 21:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

This is looking pretty nice now!  Just a few minor points.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-05-10 21:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-05-10 21:46:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> One of the key questions is how to integrate with the counterpart in instancemonitor. Several options: 1) refactor all shared code into a base class and use systemctl to control two separate services or 2)  migrate into the same service and use an configuration flag to turn on or off our new qemu-guest-agent based monitoring, 3) etc. will wait a bit to seek the consensus among us.

Sorry, I forgot to reply to this before.  This is a really good question.  My instinct is that option 1 would be best, but I'm not 100% sure.  Separate services would presumably use more memory, but I don't expect either of these to be memory-hungry so that shouldn't be a big issue.  It would also allow them to be patched / upgraded separately, but since they use the same Python modules I'm not sure there's any advantage to that.  Maybe it's worth asking for advice on openstack-dev or openstack-sigs, using the [self-healing] tag and maybe also [oslo] since I guess this is sort of related to oslo.service and similar topics?"}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-05-22 03:53:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(14 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-05-31 23:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-06-25 19:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

(13 comments)

Thanks for the feedback and will be have a new patch shortly.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-06-25 19:39:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-06-26 12:20:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I still think it would be worth removing a bit more duplicated code, but on the whole this looks great to me.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-09 03:51:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Please add release notes as you are adding a new feature.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-07-09 14:13:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Will add the release note etc. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-07-09 22:17:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Thanks for the feedback. Retested and will upload a new patch soon.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-07-09 22:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-07-10 04:02:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Thank you for addressing comments. 

Minor nits to be fixed otherwise code LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-07-10 13:34:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 22:12:21.000000000', 'message': 'Intrusive Instance Monitoring through QEMU Guest Agent

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/masakari/+spec/intrusive-instance-monitoring

Currently, Masakari instance monitoring is strictly non-intrusive black-box
type monitoring through qemu and libvirt. There are however a number of
internal instance/VM faults, that if monitored and detected by Masakari,
could be recovered by existing Masakari auto-recovery mechanisms; increasing
the overall availability of the instance/VM. This blueprint introduces the
capability of performing intrusive instance monitoring of VMs, in order to
detect, report and optionally recover VMs from internal VM faults.
Specifically, VM Heartbeating Monitoring via the QEMU Guest Agent.

Change-Id: I9efc6afc8d476003d3aa7fee8c31bcaa65438674
Implements: blueprint intrusive-instance-monitoring

commit_message:
Introspective Instance Monitoring through QEMU Guest Agent

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/masakari/+spec/introspective-instance-monitoring

Currently, Masakari instance monitoring is strictly black-box
type monitoring through qemu and libvirt. There are however a number of
internal instance/VM faults, that if monitored and detected by Masakari,
could be recovered by existing Masakari auto-recovery mechanisms; increasing
the overall availability of the instance/VM. This blueprint introduces the
capability of performing introspective instance monitoring of VMs, in order
to detect, report and optionally recover VMs from internal VM faults.
Specifically, VM Heartbeating Monitoring via the QEMU Guest Agent.

Change-Id: I9efc6afc8d476003d3aa7fee8c31bcaa65438674
Implements: blueprint introspective-instance-monitoring
