except for adding explicit system-scope enforcement tests.

* Invalid "action" (policy rule name) now correctly raises
  Forbidden instead of Unauthorized (it can never be authorized
  as the code is incorrect, and a 500 "ISE" should never be expected).
  This is equivalent behavior to an unknown rule in the oslo.policy
  enforcer.

* Added more expressive errors/warnings/exceptions for invalid actions.

* Code comments added where missing

Change-Id: I4895242555d2e9761e035d879ca2dfeb6d9b387c
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Address minor comments from initial impl RBACEnforcer

RBACEnforcer had a couple minor comments and this addresses all
except for adding explicit system-scope enforcement tests.

* Invalid "action" (policy rule name) now correctly raises
  Forbidden instead of Unauthorized (it can never be authorized
  as the code is incorrect, and a 500 "ISE" should never be expected).
  This is equivalent behavior to an unknown rule in the oslo.policy
  enforcer.

* Added more expressive errors/warnings/exceptions for invalid actions.

* Code comments added where missing

Change-Id: I4895242555d2e9761e035d879ca2dfeb6d9b387c
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Move keystone.server.common to keystone.server

The common functions are mostly removed and these make sense to
be part of the __init__.py. This also simplifies imports and
eliminates odd import errors due to duplicated names and masking
the names e.g. (and keystone.server.flask needs the functions
from keystone.server.common):

keystone.server.flask.common
keystone.server.common

Change-Id: Ie586fd45e10c8a1c8db3d9a64f949c97004814d9
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Add support for enforce_call to set value on flask.g

When enforce_call is called, flask.g has the appropriate value set
in the known attribute location so that it can be determined if
enforce_call was used within a REST API request.

Change-Id: I08ecd2be0a80248df7041596437adb6238835153
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
[DNM]Apply Resource_Constraint for Nova-ssh.

This is a test-commit Please donot Merge this commit
Its main purpose is to verify if the resource-constraints
are applied to Nova-ssh docker container.

Change-Id: Iacba12d9e5f1591337030f6fa7a7202568a92501

commit_message:
Implement base for new RBAC Enforcer

Create the base implementation of the RBAC enforcer with compat code
for the legacy mechanism via @protected decorators.

Change-Id: I80662d9b23e706b720d56670cb849318e951a3b4
Parital-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
More description with releases

- Describes that release activities are mainly related with
  cycle-with-milestone release model projects and translation
  targets
- Documentation in openstack-manuals follows independent
  release model and project repositories can have stable branch
  documents. Let's describe this.
- Also, explains that other official project can be a release
  target to I18n team upon request assuming that there is a
  cross-project liaison to I18n team.

Change-Id: Ibbcf797b11a58fb57b7dd044d1d6948ce5b06cbc

commit_message:
Add resource Constraints to Nova containers.

This commit will constrain the dimensions of service `Nova`
and sub-containers deployed along with it.

A user can give the dimension values in `/etc/kolla/globals.yml`
the data-types just like stated in this commit.

Reference-Docs:
https://docs.docker.com/config/containers/resource_constraints/

Added Test-cases for the same.

Partially-Implements: blueprint resource-constraints
Change-Id: I6458d8fb7b26a6e7c3a9fd0d674d9cf129b0bf5d

commit_message:
Add --platform support when uploading images

Adding --platform when uploading images will set a tripleo_platform
image meta data property and prefix all images with the platform (and
arch) to make them stand out in an openstack image list.

Support is added in such a way that that image names are not altered if
no --platform is specified.  As platform really only makes sense
*within* and architecture we ensure that both options are supplied.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: Ia56d22b244cfa5dddb5d110b54a525dfd80a7aaf

commit_message:
Delete keystoneclient.client.HTTPClient and request

Using keystoneclient.httpclient.HTTPClient instead of
keystoneclient.client.HTTPClient, and using
keystoneclient.session.request instead of
keystoneclient.httpclient.request, it is recommended that
HTTPClient would be removed in '2.0.0' release.

Change-Id: I94800a6edfe8def61bb65e10338410ebf888edd2

commit_message:
Remove format constraint of client id

Since some clients use different format of client id not only uuid,
so Zaqar will support this function.

Add one option 'client_id_uuid_safe' to allow user to control
the validation of client id.

Add two options 'min_length_client_id' and 'max_length_client_id'
to allow user to control the length of client id if not using uuid.

This also requires user to ensure the client id is immutable.

Implements: blueprint remove-format-constraint-of-client-id
Change-Id: I96bc2620b09394419b66a733484ff3d8f0d56313

commit_message:
Set file size limit to 50M in the python rumtime image

The original file size limit is too small and not suitable for common
user case. This patch changes the file size limit to 50M but it could
be configurable in future.

Change-Id: Ie48c9374f8eb2b6a15416fb5ec775f6a444063c3
Story: 2002967
Task: 22973

commit_message:
Fix sensu-client image build error

In rhel/centos/oracle, we are still use ruby 2.0. Whereas latest
public_suffix depends on ruby>=2.1[0]. So we need pin public_suffix<3

[0] https://github.com/weppos/publicsuffix-ruby/commit/c6560dce166c64d8e903d0c8b5d5435d721795ad

Change-Id: Idbfe948b2281418756744cbb127c266106067571

commit_message:
Test restart of CNI and Controller kuryr pods

Create a new pod just after restart of kuryr Pod.
Check the status of kuryr pods is running after restart
This new pod should be in running state when kuryr pod is up
The test is done in a loop when:
1) The kuryr pod is a controller pod
2) The kuryr pod is a CNI pod

Depends-On: Ie961a0ceeb33a6da285afba0019551ce5b54f905
Change-Id: I209691a5ef8b984194caa5cd3a35555f43e507c0

commit_message:
Ensure that sysctl can be applied on containers

Some sysctl can be applied to containers, so we add a test
to prove our containers can do it.

Change-Id: I40e2f0af00d6d763efcbb07306791d3cd3feff0d
Fixes-Bug: #1685677
(cherry picked from commit bb76ea23f5682242df66648c5afe0c34c7c49988)

commit_message:
remove AUTHORS file from git

The AUTHORS file is generated automatically by pbr as part of building a
package, so it should not be checked in to git.

Change-Id: I1c839b79c6ff97f3515c1f61342c5054058727b9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-04 07:01:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing function assertEmpty and assertNotEmpty

assertEmpty and assertNotEmpty methods are used to
raise assertion when data exist and data not exist.

assertTrue function used under them is working
on boolean type value.

To check data exist or not, we are sending data
which is not always of boolean type.
So it is raising assertion message wrongly.

https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#unittest.TestCase.assertTrue

Change-Id: I4a964c273440ca6876dd448d282172c5b8a2ded2
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing function assertEmpty and assertNotEmpty

assertEmpty and assertNotEmpty methods are used to
raise assertion when data exist and data not exist.

assertTrue function used under them is working
on boolean type value.

To check data exist or not, we are sending data
which is not always of boolean type.
So it is raising assertion message wrongly.

https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#unittest.TestCase.assertTrue

Change-Id: I4a964c273440ca6876dd448d282172c5b8a2ded2

commit_message:
Add new octavia serial experimental job

This commit adds a new job for kuryr kubernetes:
kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-daemon-containerized-openshift-octavia-serial
The job is using containers for kuryr-cni and kuryr-controller.
It runs tests in serial.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 11:47:24.000000000', 'message': "Pass SSL options to swiftclient explicitly

Contrary to most other OpenStack's python-*clients, when being passed a
keysotneauth.Session swiftclient uses it only to find the Swift
endpoint and get itself a token, but does not use this session object
for actually connecting to Swift API afterwards.

This is why one still has to explicitly pass SSL-related options to
swiftclient when Swift API is behind SSL itself,
as those options encapsulated in the Session object won't in fact be used.

Change-Id: I1cce4f81e7fb80e4f75b8e42a9227ad909aea536
"}]
commit_message:
Pass SSL options to swiftclient explicitly

Contrary to most other OpenStack's python-*clients, when being passed a
keysotneauth.Session swiftclient uses it only to find the Swift
endpoint and get itself a token, but does not use this session object
for actually connecting to Swift API afterwards.

This is why one still has to explicitly pass SSL-related options to
swiftclient when Swift API is behind SSL itself,
as those options encapsulated in the Session object won't in fact be used.

Change-Id: I1cce4f81e7fb80e4f75b8e42a9227ad909aea536

commit_message:
Update heat container healthchecks

The default service response has changed from returning 401/400 to 300.

Change-Id: Idde1c42b5437950d315bd126f4f06fa15a856bfc
Closes-Bug: #1781296

commit_message:
Retry inspect of container images

This change parses the error output of a failed skopeo inspect to
detect if it is a missing image error, then adds tenacity retries for all
other error types.

Failures are being seen in CI due to transient AWS DNS issues, so this change
should make image inspections more resilient.

Change-Id: If5ad384cfc8783c3b10c4cc567e42f06e5c6880b
Closes-Bug: #1779213
(cherry picked from commit 2dbcc9036aed8f47467e81b028f2fae76dd28816)

commit_message:
Generate and mount wrappers for haproxy in OVN metadata agent

OVN metadata agent uses haproxy as part of its implementation.
Running it in a separate container prevents dataplane breakages
(ie. restarting VMs or spawning new ones) on agent restart/stop.
This patch triggers the creation of such sidecar container and
mounting of haproxy wrapper for spawning it in a separate
container.

Change-Id: I59e08384080cda0b6c0f03c9ed8fb6f6a5661e6b
Related-Bug: #1749209
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix variables interpolation for included roles

w/a https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/42621
Include ansible-role-container-registry roles/tasks
with handlers having the right variables scope.

Closes-Bug: #1781198
Change-Id: I26cc07aa05912c3e84d59003686eae210e924a16
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adding missing space in octavia-worker.yaml

There was missing space in the template causing Ocata/Pike
deployments failures when Octavia and Fluentd are enabled.

Change-Id: Ifed41954351337a38186b229cf24621788dc4bb4
Closes-Bug: 1759579

Change-Id: I190d234023c61ed98e69c48b1002a73caeec26cf
'}, {'created': '2017-06-26 07:42:11.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec with inspect.signature

commit_message:
Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec with inspect.signature

Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec [1] with
inspect.signature [2], which is not deprecated in Python 3.x

This was causing unit tests output to be flooded with
deprecation warnings [3]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.signature
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/43/474543/3/check/gate-keystone-python35/ae16a96/console.html.gz#_2017-06-15_22_15_16_925141

Change-Id: I190d234023c61ed98e69c48b1002a73caeec26cf

commit_message:
delete bash_completion in subcommand

There are two "completion" in the subcommand table: bash-completion
and bash_completion. but "bash_completion" is useless, so delete
it and extra code.

Change-Id: I7e6d44c1393e9d719890ae79ffd757ff0022391e
Closes-Bug: #1670123

commit_message:
Adding missing space in octavia-worker.yaml

There was missing space in the template causing Ocata/Pike
deployments failures when Octavia and Fluentd are enabled.

Change-Id: Ifed41954351337a38186b229cf24621788dc4bb4
Closes-Bug: 1759579
(cherry picked from commit 0eacb6c622a4c6b92f0d4fb6c860037999c4cdb7)

commit_message:
Remove uuid token size check from doctor

The "driver" configuration removing an outdated keystone-doctor check
from doctor.Keystone now doesn't support persistence token.

bp removed-as-of-rocky

Change-Id: I5aeda77909b0ecb8cf882fafc30b249c627dc420

commit_message:
Rename scenario job and make it voting

"legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-scenario-multinode-lvm-multibackend" job
which was named as "tempest-scenario-multinode-lvm-multibackend" run
all scenario tests including slow tests.

This job has been added as n-v to check the stability of slow tests and
it has been passing consistently after that.

Let's make this job as voting and run on check and gate pipeline so that
all scenario test can be monitored consistently.

For clear name, this commit also rename this job to "tempest-scenario-all".

Change-Id: I3522a374bcae1f285d464386d7466912f613e06a

Looks good to me but was there a reason why doc8 was ignoring D001 in the first place?'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-07-12 19:40:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This causes 149 errors to be accumulated due to lines that don't meet this requirement and therefore causes 'tox -e docs' to fail locally.  You either need to include fixes for all the long lines with this patch or abandon.

Part of the reason it may be disabled is due to long URL lines that can't meet the requirement."}, {'account_id': 18320, 'date': '2018-07-13 04:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This removal causes tox -e docs fail.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 08:45:16.000000000', 'message': 'Check pep8 without ignoring doc8 D001

Currently, doc8 check ignores D001 (line too long).
This patch removes that ignoring.

Change-Id: I09833711b9a933aec37a273be0c3509de46b77d4
'}]
commit_message:
Check pep8 without ignoring doc8 D001

Currently, doc8 check ignores D001 (line too long).
This patch removes that ignoring.

Change-Id: I09833711b9a933aec37a273be0c3509de46b77d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 10:39:43.000000000', 'message': 'Change the anti-affinity Filter to adapt to new policy

In this patch, the anti-affinity filter will get the
max_server_per_host limit from policy rules, and compare it
against the number of servers within the same group on a given
host. If the filter finds the number is not satisfied with the
limit, it will filter out this host.

The default ``max_server_per_host`` for the anti-affinity filter
is 1 for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I4b67ec9dd4ce846a704d0f75ad64c41e693de0fb
blueprint: complex-anti-affinity-policies

commit_message:
Change the ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter to adapt to new policy

In this patch, the anti-affinity filter will get the
max_server_per_host limit from policy rules, and compare it
against the number of servers within the same group on a given
host. If the filter finds the number is not satisfied with the
limit, it will filter out this host.

The default ``max_server_per_host`` for the anti-affinity filter
is 1 for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I4b67ec9dd4ce846a704d0f75ad64c41e693de0fb
blueprint: complex-anti-affinity-policies

commit_message:
Add policy field to ServerGroup notification object

In this patch, the ServerGroupPayload is updated to include
the new ``policy`` field; the ``policies`` field is deprecated
for removal but still put into the notification payload for
backward compatibility.

Related to blueprint complex-anti-affinity-policies

Change-Id: Ie739ee8dec4685cd70e735ff83f7f30bc7e95a57

subject: Fix RedHat family image building
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2245, 'name': 'Jacky Hu', 'email': 'hudayou@hotmail.com', 'username': 'hudayou'}, {'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 6732, 'name': 'Lingxian Kong', 'email': 'anlin.kong@gmail.com', 'username': 'kong'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-09 16:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-07-09 20:38:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

While I can see the problem, I'm here thinking how did octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario-kvm-centos.7 pass CI in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569531/. Unfortunately logs are no longer available. Could you please enlighten me? :)"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-09 22:02:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thanks Michael for the fix, i will test this patch today'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-09 22:29:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Carlos, that is a very good question and likely why I didn't catch this at development time."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-09 22:41:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ah, removing non-existent packages on fedora is an error, while on centos it is not an error.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-07-09 23:23:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm not much in favor of mixing ubuntu stuff on red hat-family parts. How about reverting I2417e1bdf12456b039527584de098391e95d3c2b and add a post-install.d script?

#!/bin/bash

if [ "${DIB_DEBUG_TRACE:-0}" -gt 0 ]; then
    set -x
fi
set -eu
set -o pipefail

if [ $DISTRO_NAME = 'ubuntu' ] ; then
    install-packages -e ubuntu-core-launcher snapd
fi'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-09 23:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Tested, works for me'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-10 01:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Carlos, This is the correct way to handle distro differences with packages. That is the whole purpose of pkg-map.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-07-10 07:39:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Ok. I don't fully agree but I understand it is expected way of doing things."}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-07-13 00:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-07-13 01:32:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix RedHat family image building

A recent change to address Ubuntu cloud image size issues broke
image building on the stable branches. This patch excludes the
Ubuntu package removal from the RedHat family of images.

Change-Id: I1630fe200785d41f3b037798ca84b909e8e74212
Story: 2002917
Task: 22895

[{'created': '2017-08-11 07:26:43.000000000', 'message': "[WiP] Another one of tonyb's silly ideas.

The purpose of this tool is to append a templated string to a commit message
in the scenario that the requirements repo has branched but the project
repo has not.  This could indicated that the proposed changes are destined
for the next release of OpenStack and shoudl be reviewed carefully.

We'd need to talk to infra about this as we can *in theory* use this
tool in propose-updates.  It doesn't actually fix anything so I'm not
convinced that it's worth it.

Change-Id: I9874e801f2e7ac511d1f3a7a75467c7747b14ddd
"}]
commit_message:
[WiP] Another one of tonyb's silly ideas.

The purpose of this tool is to append a templated string to a commit message
in the scenario that the requirements repo has branched but the project
repo has not.  This could indicated that the proposed changes are destined
for the next release of OpenStack and shoudl be reviewed carefully.

We'd need to talk to infra about this as we can *in theory* use this
tool in propose-updates.  It doesn't actually fix anything so I'm not
convinced that it's worth it.

Change-Id: I9874e801f2e7ac511d1f3a7a75467c7747b14ddd

commit_message:
Remove show_image_direct_url for ceph plugin

To fix it we change the default param to True.
'show_image_direct_url' will be overridden.
Currently glance v2 doesn't allow to specify custom
locations for image by default, it returns 403.


Closes-Bug: #1740223

Related to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/279630/2

Change-Id: Ib4dd54c69830ab8f3f9812877b026f81c23c224a

[{'created': '2018-06-29 05:51:02.000000000', 'message': 'Modify logic of l3-agent to be notified

Although no DVR router is hosted on controller node, neutron-server notifies l3-agent on compute node.
As a result, the following bug happen when VM migrate or resize.
　1) L3-agent on compute node output error logs when VM connect no DVR and HA router.
　2) Unused namespace is appeared on compute node when VM connect no DVR and no HA router.
So, I modify logic of l3-agent to be notified after migrating or resizing.

Change-Id: I53955b885f53d4ee15377a08627c2c25cb1b7041
Closes-Bug: #1775310

commit_message:
Modify logic of l3-agent to be notified

Although no DVR router is hosted on controller node,
neutron-server notifies l3-agent on compute node.
As a result, the following bug happen when VM migrate or resize.
　1) L3-agent on compute node output error logs
     when VM connect no DVR and HA router.
　2) Unused namespace is appeared on compute node
     when VM connect no DVR and no HA router.
So, I modify logic of l3-agent to be notified
after migrating or resizing.

Change-Id: I53955b885f53d4ee15377a08627c2c25cb1b7041
Closes-Bug: #1775310

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 14:21:26.000000000', 'message': "Only subnet owner should be able use its gateway

Currently, a non privileged tenant can add a router interface to a
shared / external network's subnet, taking over its gateway IP address.
This creates a conflict in provider networks where the gateway function
is performed by an external router. This patch prevents tenants who are
not the subnet's owner or admin from assigning a router interface to
it.

Change-Id: I32e76a83443dd8e7d79b396499747f29b4762e92
Closes-Bug: #1757482
"}, {'created': '2018-06-15 23:59:35.000000000', 'message': "Disallow router interface out of subnet IP range

tenants who are not the subnet's owner or admin from assigning a router

commit_message:
Disallow router interface out of subnet IP range

Currently, a non privileged tenant can add a router interface to a
shared / external network's subnet with an IP address outside the
subnet's allocation pool, creating a security risk. This patch prevents
tenants who are not the subnet's owner or admin from assigning a router
interface an IP address outside the subnet's allocation pool.

Change-Id: I32e76a83443dd8e7d79b396499747f29b4762e92
Closes-Bug: #1757482

[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:06:42.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I450085ff6d9cc352ff38798c361cbe2fbebce263
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 02:17:51.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like

Change-Id: I450085ff6d9cc352ff38798c361cbe2fbebce263
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I450085ff6d9cc352ff38798c361cbe2fbebce263
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix missing docs command mapping for status show

We missed updating the neutron command mapping update to reflect that
we have added the "openstack loadbalancer status show" command.
This patch updates the command mapping table to include the
"status show" command.

It's probably obvious, but what's the problem with having log warnings from the output of tests? In some cases it's unavoidable other than to mock out the log -- is that what you are suggesting where appropriate?

Also is your comment just about WARN or about ERROR too? You said 'warning' but posted an example of ERROR."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2016-06-01 11:52:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For the messageing we should be using the fake driver for the testing.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2016-06-01 14:26:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Gary -- The ERRORs and WARNINGs you are referring to are a result of the test_rpc.TimeoutTestCase tests. As you can see in the class:


self.messaging_conf.transport_driver = 'fake'


Since these tests are really targetting the backoff functionality of our RPC client, the ERROR and WARNING logs messages are part of normal operation of this test. The only way to remove them would be the mock out the LOG.


Are you suggesting I mock out LOG to remove these?"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2016-06-01 14:27:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Armando: I think your codesearch is missing most of the hits, try [1]. As you can see neutron.common.rpc has fairly extensive usage outside of neutron and UTs.


In particular I'm focusing on l2gw that needs rpc [2].



[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron.common%20import%20rpc&i=nope&files=&repos=
[2] https://github.com/openstack/networking-l2gw/blob/master/networking_l2gw/services/l2gateway/l2gw_agent.py#L18"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2016-08-24 22:17:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

You're right, though I am still not quite convinced this glue is worth salvaging. I think the backoff client was supposed to go directly in oslo_messaging, as for the rest, it's glue that is perhaps beyond its useful life."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2016-08-24 22:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Code-Review

I suppose if you want to rehome this but not expose it I should not stop you.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2016-08-26 13:17:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Workflow-1

Armando: thanks for the insight.


I am working on getting the backing off client into olso, but it'll be awhile as we are working to replace openstack's usage of the retrying lib with something else (for ref [1]). This replacement needs to happen before moving the backing off client over.


I looked through some of the usages of neutron.common.rpc with the code search, and it does appear most of them are using just a handful of rpc glue functions that could likely end up in oslo with the backing off client.


That said I don't see any point on moving rpc into lib and keeping it private.


Let me work on getting the backing off client into oslo.messaging and then we can revisit this topic. Hopefully will find there's no need for rpc in lib at that point. I'll probably leave this review open in case others want to comment and provide their $0.02 in the meantime.



[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/321867/"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2016-10-14 17:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-05-20 15:56:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add neutron common rpc

This patch brings over neutron.common.rpc as part of
our base agent effort [1]. In order to remove the dependency
on neutron.common.exceptions:
(a) ALLOWED_EXMODS is updated to only include the
neutron-lib exceptions by default.
(b) rpc.init() is updated to accept an extra_extmods kwarg
allowing consumers to pass in additional extmods. If extra
extmods are passed, init() adds them using
add_extra_exmods().
Consumers of neutron-lib.rpc.init() will need to be updated
to pass in neutron exceptions for extmods where appropriate
once merged into neutron-lib.

Additionally the test_rpc unit tests from neutron are brought
over. Finally a new unit test method is added to verify the
behavior of init() as described above W/R/T passing
extra_extmods.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron_lib_base_agent

Change-Id: I0052ba65973a993e088943056879bc6e982bd0b5

'}, {'created': '2016-08-15 19:44:31.000000000', 'message': "Rehome neutron common rpc

This patch rehomes neutron.common.rpc into neutron_lib.
As it uses neutron_lib._context, this module is also made private.
Once _context is made public we can update this as well.

NB: I'll plan to add a follow-on patch that includes docstrings for
the public functions in here. We can get that done + pretty before
making this public (along with _context).

Changes from the neutron impl as part of this rehome:
- ALLOWED_EXMODS only includes neutron_lib's exceptions by
default. Consumers wishing to add others (e.g. neutron) can use
the add_extra_exmods() prior to init().
- A handful of changes in the UTs in order to run in neutron_lib and
also to achieve 100% coverage.

Change-Id: I0052ba65973a993e088943056879bc6e982bd0b5
"}, {'created': '2016-08-19 20:36:31.000000000', 'message': "Rehome neutron common rpc

This patch rehomes neutron.common.rpc into neutron_lib.
As it uses neutron_lib._context, this module is also made private.
Once _context is made public we can update this as well.

NB: I'll plan to add a follow-on patch that includes docstrings for
the public functions in here. We can get that done + pretty before
making this public (along with _context).

Changes from the neutron impl as part of this rehome:
- ALLOWED_EXMODS only includes neutron_lib's exceptions by
default. Consumers wishing to add others (e.g. neutron) can use
the add_extra_exmods() prior to init().
- A handful of changes in the UTs in order to run in neutron_lib and
also to achieve 100% coverage.

Change-Id: I0052ba65973a993e088943056879bc6e982bd0b5
"}, {'created': '2018-04-09 20:34:11.000000000', 'message': "COMMENTS NEEDED: rehome rpc and related plumbing

As shown in the history of this patch, along with the work in [1], we've
discussed rehoming neutron.common.rpc into lib a number of times before.
One of the main reasons we've decided not to rehome in the past is that
we'd hoped the neutron.common.rcp.BackingOffClient and related plumbing
could be put into oslo.messaging. However, it's 2 years later and that
still hasn't happened [2][3].

This patch proposes we just move forward with the rehome so that we can
begin to untangle the consumers [4]. There's no reason we can't
reiterate on this code in lib; it's no more difficult than in neutron.

To rehome the neutron.common.rpc module the following is included:
- The neutron.common.exceptions.
- The fake notifier used in mocking/testing.
- A fixture for mocking out the major portion of the rpc module.
- A simple runtime util function that loads all the
neutron_lib.exceptions sub-modules so they are available via RPC.

TODOs:
- Break neutron_lib.exceptions.common into their respective exception
module.
- Unit tests.
- Release note.
- Documentation as needed.
- Doc strings.

Sample consumption patch (py27 ran green locally):
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559829/

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/project:openstack/neutron-lib+message:rpc
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/407722/
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1667445
[4] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron.common%20import%20rpc

Change-Id: I0052ba65973a993e088943056879bc6e982bd0b5

"}, {'created': '2018-07-05 22:15:39.000000000', 'message': "rehome rpc and related plumbing

As shown in the history of this patch, along with the work in [1], we've
discussed rehoming neutron.common.rpc into lib a number of times before.
One of the main reasons we've decided not to rehome in the past is that
we'd hoped the neutron.common.rcp.BackingOffClient and related plumbing
could be put into oslo.messaging. However, it's 2 years later and that
still hasn't happened [2][3].

This patch proposes we just move forward with the rehome so that we can
begin to untangle the consumers [4]. There's no reason we can't
reiterate on this code in lib; it's no more difficult than in neutron.

This patch includes rehoming of:
- neutron.common.rpc, the only difference in the lib version is that
we dynamically add all neutron_lib.exceptions by default (_DFT_EXMODS).
- neutron.common.exceptions, but exceptions are broken out into their
respective exception modules rather than lumping all together in a
generic single module.
- The fake notifier and RPC fixture, without any real changes.
- A new runtime util method to dynamically load all modules for a
package.

For a sample neutron consumption patch see [5] that was tested with
PS10 herein.

[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579989/

commit_message:
rehome rpc and related plumbing

As shown in the history of this patch, along with the work in [1], we've
discussed rehoming neutron.common.rpc into lib a number of times before.
One of the main reasons we've decided not to rehome in the past is that
we'd hoped the neutron.common.rcp.BackingOffClient and related plumbing
could be put into oslo.messaging. However, it's 2 years later and that
still hasn't happened [2][3].

This patch proposes we just move forward with the rehome so that we can
begin to untangle the consumers [4]. There's no reason we can't
reiterate on this code in lib; it's no more difficult than in neutron.

This patch includes rehoming of:
- neutron.common.rpc, the only difference in the lib version is that
we dynamically add all neutron_lib.exceptions by default (_DFT_EXMODS).
- neutron.common.exceptions, but exceptions are broken out into their
respective exception modules rather than lumping all together in a
generic single module.
- The fake notifier and RPC fixture, without any real changes.
- A new runtime util method to dynamically load all modules for a
package.

For a sample neutron consumption patch see [5] that was tested with
PS10 herein.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/project:openstack/neutron-lib+message:rpc
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/407722/
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1667445
[4] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron.common%20import%20rpc
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579989/

Change-Id: I0052ba65973a993e088943056879bc6e982bd0b5

commit_message:
Handle rebuild of instances with image traits

Update the conductor to handle rebuilding of an instance. If a rebuild
is requested with an image with traits, we check the current allocations
of the instance against the image required traits and allow the action
only if the current allocations can satisfy the image requirements.

Change-Id: Ie49d605c66062d2548241d7e04f5a2a6b98c011e
Implements: blueprint glance-image-traits

commit_message:
Switch ironic-dsvm-standalone to zuulv3 native

Move ironic-dsvm-standalone away from using the legacy
format converted fromt the project-config repository.

Also enables 3 more tempest jobs(BaremetalAgentIpmitool*)
that were being skipped as agent_ipmitool wasn't configured.

Change-Id: Ic01bf1849620c6d095f130e445c92888548d00c5

subject: Switch ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-partition-redfish-tinyipa

subject: First release of neutron-tempest-plugin
messages:
[{'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-07-10 21:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-07-10 22:02:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm curious why the file isn't in the deliverables/_independent directory since it's not tied to any release - and if i move it there everything works fine.  But there were a lot created in the rocky directory recently."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-10 22:12:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

I'll work up reviews to fix the validate errors"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-10 22:14:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm curious why the file isn't in the deliverables/_independent
 > directory since it's not tied to any release - and if i move it
 > there everything works fine.  But there were a lot created in the
 > rocky directory recently.

That's a fair question.  I don't really know we seem to accept a mix"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-10 22:54:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > I'm curious why the file isn't in the deliverables/_independent
 > > directory since it's not tied to any release - and if i move it
 > > there everything works fine.  But there were a lot created in the
 > > rocky directory recently.
 > 
 > That's a fair question.  I don't really know we seem to accept a
 > mix

We won't branch the tempest plugins, but we do want to know which versions work with each series. There was a mailing list thread about this. The interesting part of the thread starts with http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131828.html"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-10 23:27:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-10 23:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-10 23:29:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Setting WiP as I'm not 100% I've done the template addition correctly"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-10 23:48:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> We won't branch the tempest plugins, but we do want to know which
 > versions work with each series. There was a mailing list thread
 > about this. The interesting part of the thread starts with
 > http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131828.html

Thanks Doug"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-07-11 12:57:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

First release of neutron-tempest-plugin

This patch adds the tag for the first release of the
neutron-tempest-plugin

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/581887

commit_message:
Move create_keypair to api.base module and add creation params.

For coherence with other resources move create_keypair to base class
an add more creation parameters.

This also fix deletion of keypairs when are created with other
clients than default one.

Change-Id: Iff0b7ffdb17235a75c37a3890db1445b95547554

Replace autodoc with sphinxcontrib-apidoc

Fix local docs builds back to the new docs PTI.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Also clean up after the removal of osc_lib.session

commit_message:
Add FFU upgrade steps to Sahara services

Those steps should be enough to have Sahara properly working,
following the patterns established by other services:
- the non-containerized services are disabled between Ocata and Pike;
- the database is upgrades.

Closes-Bug: #1780134
Change-Id: I68c5e6c6dd969934c85409b8cee9919454e88474

commit_message:
Make it easy to identify a 404 from Flask

This change makes (for test purposes) the Flask app return a 418
instead of a 404 if the path is unrouted. This allows easy
identification (programmatically) if the 404 is issued from Flask
or is a handled 404 such as "UserNotFound"

Parital-Bug: #1776504
Change-Id: I0475d9b6315250d9c3384be63c14a81fbd1c7b7c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 16:34:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix meter-label-rule creation

The existing method is to meter outgoing traffic from the entire VM
to a specific "remote_ip_addr"(in case of outbound),
but the method I suggested can meter outgoing traffic
from a particular subnet to external network.

From a metering point of view,
it does not matter which address/CIDR is the destination for outbound.
But, it is important to know where(subnet or VM) the packet leaves from.
That way you can see how much VMs are using the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs
and for inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct
to specify src address for "remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound
and specify dst address for inbound.
If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix",
you need to clarify this option.

Change-Id: Ia3f3e26410a73d7b44abae637703fda41c4bc09a
Closes-Bug: #1716913
(cherry picked from commit 92db1d4a2c49b1f675b6a9552a8cc5a417973b64)
'}, {'created': '2018-04-20 17:58:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix meter-label-rule creation

to a specific "remote_ip_addr"(in case of outbound),
but the method I suggested can meter outgoing traffic
from a particular subnet to external network.

But, it is important to know where(subnet or VM) the packet leaves from.
That way you can see how much VMs are using the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs
and for inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct
to specify src address for "remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound
and specify dst address for inbound.
If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix",
you need to clarify this option.

Change-Id: Ia3f3e26410a73d7b44abae637703fda41c4bc09a
Closes-Bug: #1716913
(cherry picked from commit 92db1d4a2c49b1f675b6a9552a8cc5a417973b64)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix meter-label-rule creation

The existing method is to meter outgoing traffic from the entire VM
to a specific "remote_ip_addr"(in case of outbound),
but the method I suggested can meter outgoing traffic
from a particular subnet to external network.

From a metering point of view,
it does not matter which address/CIDR is the destination for outbound.
But, it is important to know where(subnet or VM) the packet leaves from.
That way you can see how much VMs are using the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs
and for inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct
to specify src address for "remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound
and specify dst address for inbound.
If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix",
you need to clarify this option.

Change-Id: Ia3f3e26410a73d7b44abae637703fda41c4bc09a
Closes-Bug: #1716913
(cherry picked from commit 92db1d4a2c49b1f675b6a9552a8cc5a417973b64)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-06 21:28:00.000000000', 'message': 'Make deployment_swift_data updateable

Allows the server property deployment_swift_data to be updated. This
will be useful for those users that used the DeployedServer resource in
their templates prior to this property being available.

commit_message:
Make deployment_swift_data updateable

Allows the server property deployment_swift_data to be updated. This
will be useful for those users that used the DeployedServer resource in
their templates prior to this property being available.

Change-Id: I4414ec9e29a8f4f2de03a1540350308ad33e04da
Closes-Bug: #1702750

awesome :)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-06-27 13:51:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Here too :)'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-07-05 21:00:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-07-12 21:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 16:34:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix meter-label-rule creation

The existing method is to meter outgoing traffic from the entire VM
to a specific "remote_ip_addr"(in case of outbound),
but the method I suggested can meter outgoing traffic
from a particular subnet to external network.

From a metering point of view,
it does not matter which address/CIDR is the destination for outbound.
But, it is important to know where(subnet or VM) the packet leaves from.
That way you can see how much VMs are using the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs
and for inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct
to specify src address for "remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound
and specify dst address for inbound.
If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix",
you need to clarify this option.

Change-Id: Ia3f3e26410a73d7b44abae637703fda41c4bc09a
Closes-Bug: #1716913
(cherry picked from commit 92db1d4a2c49b1f675b6a9552a8cc5a417973b64)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix meter-label-rule creation

The existing method is to meter outgoing traffic from the entire VM
to a specific "remote_ip_addr"(in case of outbound),
but the method I suggested can meter outgoing traffic
from a particular subnet to external network.

From a metering point of view,
it does not matter which address/CIDR is the destination for outbound.
But, it is important to know where(subnet or VM) the packet leaves from.
That way you can see how much VMs are using the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs
and for inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct
to specify src address for "remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound
and specify dst address for inbound.
If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix",
you need to clarify this option.

Change-Id: Ia3f3e26410a73d7b44abae637703fda41c4bc09a
Closes-Bug: #1716913
(cherry picked from commit 92db1d4a2c49b1f675b6a9552a8cc5a417973b64)

commit_message:
Don't replace the whole app just the wsgi_app backing

Do not replace the entire app when wrapping with middleware. It is
important to maintain all the flask-functionality on the app object
and ensure any/all test client calls go through the entire stack of
app and middleware.

Partial-Bug: #1776504
Change-Id: I928d08e96b4c79807ad8c312ba17359c54b67fa0

A bug was introduced in change id
d86000271a0af1d40eed9d55f1663678992d07a8 which removed vpnaas package

commit_message:
Fix ocata pike

A bug was introduced in change id
d86000271a0af1d40eed9d55f1663678992d07a8 which removed vpnaas package
at ocata.

This restores the vpnaas package for all but >= pike.

Change-Id: I97188c63062686960de2e13af8535df83968ec6c

Fix usage of "|" for tests

With the more recent versions of ansible, we should now use
"is" instead of the "|" sign for the tests.

This should fix it.

commit_message:
Filter out conntrack entries with unknown protocol

This patch updates the legacy conntrack driver to skip listing
(and deleting) any conntrack entries  with an unknown protocol.

The conntrack driver currently handles sessions for
TCP/UDP/ICMP/ICMP6 protocols only.

Change-Id: I53439c3f614d1a6ae7b3d679c018065d700316c5
Closes-Bug: #1753507
(cherry picked from commit 4aa3cec16e341023dea12c7c6af1b9805be6bd81)

commit_message:
DVR-FWaaS: Fix DVR FWaaS rules for fipnamespace

FWaaS for DVR routers were only supported for
North-South traffic. But with the recent change
in the DVR router-info to handle FloatingIP's
as mentioned in the reference patch[1], the
dist_fip_count variable was removed and was
replaced by rtr_fip_connect.

So change in variable 'rtr_fip_connect' was
not fixed in FWaaS.

This patch fixes it in the FWaaS to apply
the Firewall rule in the router namespace
for the North-South traffic.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/283757

Closes-Bug: #1715395
Change-Id: Id8c902381f95e39bc13e3b3aeeeaa799c72f0dca
(cherry picked from commit 5706252c7947887e3c5b00f258dd847027497b97)

commit_message:
DVR-FWaaS: Fix DVR FWaaS rules for fipnamespace

FWaaS for DVR routers were only supported for
North-South traffic. But with the recent change
in the DVR router-info to handle FloatingIP's
as mentioned in the reference patch[1], the
dist_fip_count variable was removed and was
replaced by rtr_fip_connect.

So change in variable 'rtr_fip_connect' was
not fixed in FWaaS.

This patch fixes it in the FWaaS to apply
the Firewall rule in the router namespace
for the North-South traffic.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/283757

Closes-Bug: #1715395
Change-Id: Id8c902381f95e39bc13e3b3aeeeaa799c72f0dca
(cherry picked from commit 5706252c7947887e3c5b00f258dd847027497b97)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 17:15:49.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I2e33c4cb468e93259860b600719d87c4022d6805
"}]
commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I2e33c4cb468e93259860b600719d87c4022d6805

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 07:38:22.000000000', 'message': 'Windows: fix exec calls

At some point, we've switched to an alternative process launcher
that uses named pipes to communicate with the child processes. This
implementation has some issues, truncating the process output in some
situations.

This change switches back to subprocess.Popen, which is a much easier
and convenient way to perform exec calls. We're also ensuring that the
os module is not patched (which would cause subprocess.Popen to fail
on Windows due to an eventlet limitation, the reason why the above
mentioned implementation was first introduced).

We're also ensuring that such calls do not block other greenthreads
by leveraging eventlet.tpool.

Side note: I had to store subprocess.Popen in a variable in order
to avoid having OpenStack bandit complaining, even though we're
explicitly passing "shell=False":
http://paste.openstack.org/raw/658319/

Closes-Bug: #1709931

Change-Id: Ib58e12030e69ea10862452c2f141a7a5f2527621
(cherry picked from commit 82d468ba7fd6dce91fec015d39126e71c1434fb1)

commit_message:
Windows: fix exec calls

At some point, we've switched to an alternative process launcher
that uses named pipes to communicate with the child processes. This
implementation has some issues, truncating the process output in some
situations.

This change switches back to subprocess.Popen, which is a much easier
and convenient way to perform exec calls. We're also ensuring that the
os module is not patched (which would cause subprocess.Popen to fail
on Windows due to an eventlet limitation, the reason why the above
mentioned implementation was first introduced).

We're also ensuring that such calls do not block other greenthreads
by leveraging eventlet.tpool.

Side note: I had to store subprocess.Popen in a variable in order
to avoid having OpenStack bandit complaining, even though we're
explicitly passing "shell=False":
http://paste.openstack.org/raw/658319/

Closes-Bug: #1709931

Change-Id: Ib58e12030e69ea10862452c2f141a7a5f2527621
(cherry picked from commit 82d468ba7fd6dce91fec015d39126e71c1434fb1)

commit_message:
Enable publishing to pypi for neutron-tempest-plugin

As this is fresh ground I picked the python3 job so wer don't have debt.
I registered the package on pypi yesterday and added openstckci

 >>> import xmlrpc.client
 >>> client = xmlrpc.client.ServerProxy('https://pypi.org/pypi')
 >>> client.package_roles('neutron_tempest_plugin')
 [['Owner', 'openstackci'], ['Owner', 'o-tony']]

Change-Id: I32a191befacb94aac316f91e847903aa8b4ea28f

commit_message:
use plugin utils from neutron-lib

The remainder of the neutron.plugins.common.utils were rehomed into
neutron-lib with [1][2]. This patch consumes them by using the functions
from neutron-lib, and removing the neutron.plugins.common.utils module
all together as it's fully rehomed now.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560950/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554546/

Change-Id: Ic0f7b37861f078ce8c5ee92d97e977b8d2b468ad

commit_message:
Adopt hacking 1.1.0

This incorporates flake8 2.6.x and pycodestyle will be used
instead of older pep8.  This ensures future python3 compatibility
and a bit better code styling.

Change-Id: Ia7c7c5a44727f615a151e1e68dd94c7ed42f974f

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: compare_ecmp and default LOCAL_PREF

Modify compare_ecmp method to use default LOCAL_PREF as defined in exabgp if
not set in route.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: I144b01c5870f2b26f15dcd63eb90c2674bd1abc2
Depends-On: I1b9a8bca500eedbe2c42cb8acfc6f37f12a51a5f
Closes-Bug: 1758296
(cherry picked from commit 64f8dfaca73b61130709441b79ae464325675ddd)

commit_message:
Add default roles used by Barbican

The default roles used by Barbican are missing.
According to the policy.json the Key Manager
comes with, four roles have to be defined.

Depends-On: I999aa55269348497154a8eb073c2ff663242af4e
Change-Id: If50e02a5886a1f3b26eb033103904122302afeda
Closes-Bug: #1657742

commit_message:
Fix DVR scheduling checks wrong profile for host

When DVR scheduling in live-migration, the current implementation in DVR
serviceable ports checking on host performs a "contains" operation of
sub-string match which checks the wrong port binding profile for host
(i.e. compute-1 will also match compute-10).

Add quotes to force an exact match of the host name in the port binding
profile dictionary to address this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1776255
Change-Id: I0d2bd9b9ff0aa58a7cce1b8da2a5f21ac6b38c57
Signed-off-by: Kailun Qin <kailun.qin@intel.com>
(cherry picked from commit e356345261737162aab90bf7338d931d64ae524e)

commit_message:
Fix DVR scheduling checks wrong profile for host

When DVR scheduling in live-migration, the current implementation in DVR
serviceable ports checking on host performs a "contains" operation of
sub-string match which checks the wrong port binding profile for host
(i.e. compute-1 will also match compute-10).

Add quotes to force an exact match of the host name in the port binding
profile dictionary to address this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1776255
Change-Id: I0d2bd9b9ff0aa58a7cce1b8da2a5f21ac6b38c57
Signed-off-by: Kailun Qin <kailun.qin@intel.com>
(cherry picked from commit e356345261737162aab90bf7338d931d64ae524e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 13:06:17.000000000', 'message': '[Logging] Enable filtering of trace_api logs

This improvement allows trace_api decorators to be
passed a filter function argument, which can validate
the parameters of the object being logged to decide
to not filter it.

Change-Id: I2dbf5583b8d2c9b9afe35bc5a916f480637d79f5
'}]
commit_message:
[Logging] Enable filtering of trace_api logs

This improvement allows trace_api decorators to be
passed a filter function argument, which can validate
the parameters of the object being logged to decide
to not filter it.

Change-Id: I2dbf5583b8d2c9b9afe35bc5a916f480637d79f5

[{'created': '2018-06-27 06:42:19.000000000', 'message': "Handling type's multiattach extra specs in API task flow

This patch fixs two issues related to multiattach extra specs:

1. Volume's multiattach attribute will always be False if it's
   created by a multiattach type while type is specified in source
   volume, snapshot, image metadata or config file, related patch [1].
2. 'MULTIATTACH_POLICY' will not be validated if multiattach flag is
   specified in the volume type that from source volume, snapshot,
   image metadata or config file [2].

[1]: a32e24ff3e2c3083b42dd3654355f8c101363147
[2]: ff30971d1f7b1f4febdef9358a999017bea2296d
Closes-Bug: #1770671

Change-Id: Ibec0656d9ead726ca12e62091fda74c04ec99eda
"}, {'created': '2018-06-28 01:48:23.000000000', 'message': "Handling type's multiattach extra specs in API task flow

   volume, snapshot, image metadata or config file, related patch [1].

   image metadata or config file [2].

[1]: a32e24ff3e2c3083b42dd3654355f8c101363147

commit_message:
Handling type's multiattach extra specs in API task flow

This patch fixs two issues related to multiattach extra specs:

1. Volume's multiattach attribute will always be False if it's
   created by a multiattach type while type is specified in source
   volume, snapshot, image metadata or config file, related patch [1].
2. 'MULTIATTACH_POLICY' will not be validated if multiattach flag is
   specified in the volume type that from source volume, snapshot,
   image metadata or config file [2].

[1]: a32e24ff3e2c3083b42dd3654355f8c101363147
[2]: ff30971d1f7b1f4febdef9358a999017bea2296d
Closes-Bug: #1770671

Change-Id: Ibec0656d9ead726ca12e62091fda74c04ec99eda

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 17:03:36.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I673a465863559d6fc72e4fdcd5da2ab788e561ab
"}]
commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I673a465863559d6fc72e4fdcd5da2ab788e561ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 12:00:38.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] quick'n'dirty way to at least protect and correct rights on files

Currently the rights on some files are wrong due to wild "sudo" calls
in the deploy process.

The right way would be to get a proper privileges escalation using
oslo.privsep, but as this spec is for Stein, we still need some
corrections for the previous versions.

Please keep in mind this is a quick fix, NOT a final nor proper
solution.

Based on a previously abandonned (and unmergeable) proposal.

Change-Id: I418d41c91d008283360ffaaa7b3a38354e405423
Closes-Bug: #1761595
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

oslo.privsep, but as this spec is for Stein, we still need some
corrections for the previous versions.

Please keep in mind this is a quick fix, NOT a final nor proper
solution.

Based on a previously abandonned (unmergeable) proposal.

commit_message:
Quick'n'dirty way to at least protect and correct rights on files

Currently the rights on some files are wrong due to wild "sudo" calls
in the deploy process.

The right way would be to get a proper privileges escalation using
oslo.privsep, but as this spec is for Stein, we still need some
corrections for the previous versions.

Please keep in mind this is a quick fix, NOT a final nor proper
solution.

Based on a previously abandonned (unmergeable) proposal.

Change-Id: I418d41c91d008283360ffaaa7b3a38354e405423
Closes-Bug: #1761595
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

subject: Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-12 16:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-12 20:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-07-12 21:17:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 16:42:54.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. The masakari client is not used on the host, so
it serves no purpose. As there are no required packages left, the task to
install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I5f4339b322b967fcfd326c7442d634abf8b6cb05
"}]
commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. The masakari client is not used on the host, so
it serves no purpose. As there are no required packages left, the task to
install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I5f4339b322b967fcfd326c7442d634abf8b6cb05

commit_message:
Remove testrepository and .testr.conf

This commit is a follow-up of "switch to using stestr"
which was merged already [1].
After switch to using stestr, testrepository and .testr.conf
are unnecessary and should be removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/574248

Change-Id: I95be906a541792f06ba6206a3f25a5e3437d9fb0

subject: Fix for python 3
messages: [{'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2018-06-15 10:38:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2018-07-12 20:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 10:38:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for python 3

In Python 3, get_reponse returns a bytes object, not str, so we
have to encode() and decode(), otherwise it fails. This fixed
issues running the tests in Debian.

Change-Id: Ifc18bb48e27cee96864e3a9b64d8a4fd294a912b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for python 3

In Python 3, get_reponse returns a bytes object, not str, so we
have to encode() and decode(), otherwise it fails. This fixed
issues running the tests in Debian.

Change-Id: Ifc18bb48e27cee96864e3a9b64d8a4fd294a912b
